title.raw: 《項羽本紀》 Annals of Xiang Yu

sentences.zh: 項籍者，下相人也，字羽。

translations.literal: Xiang Ji one, Xia Xiang person also, style Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji was a man from Xiaxiang, styled Yu.

sentences.zh: 初起時，年二十四。

translations.literal: Initially rose time, age twenty-four.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when the First Emperor toured the east, Xiang Ji and Xiang Liang raised him.

sentences.zh: 其季父項梁，梁父即楚將項燕，為秦將王翦所戮者也。

translations.literal: His youngest uncle Xiang Liang, Liang father namely Chu general Xiang Yan, was Qin general Wang Jian what beheaded ones also.
translations.idiomatic: They said: "This child has an extraordinary appearance."

sentences.zh: 項氏世世為楚將，封於項，故姓項氏。

translations.literal: Xiang clan generation generation was Chu generals, enfeoffed at Xiang, therefore surname Xiang clan.
translations.idiomatic: The First Emperor was furious.

translations.literal: Xiang Ji was a Xiaxiang native, styled Yu. When he first rose up, he was twenty-four years old. His youngest uncle was Xiang Liang. Liang's father was the Chu general Xiang Yan, who was beheaded by the Qin general Wang Jian. The Xiang clan generation after generation were Chu generals, enfeoffed at Xiang, therefore they took the surname Xiang.

sentences.zh: 項籍少時，學書不成，去學劍，又不成。

translations.literal: Xiang Ji young time, studied writing not succeed, left studied sword, again not succeed.
translations.idiomatic: He said: "Xiang Ji is a descendant of Xiang Yan.

sentences.zh: 項梁怒之。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang angered him.
translations.idiomatic: He might rebel against me."

sentences.zh: 籍曰：「書足以記名姓而已。

translations.literal: Ji said: 'Writing sufficient record names surnames only.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered someone to kill Xiang Ji.

sentences.zh: 劍一人敵，不足學，學萬人敵。」

translations.literal: Sword one person enemy, not sufficient learn, learn ten thousand people enemy.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji was strong and could not be harmed.

sentences.zh: 於是項梁乃教籍兵法，籍大喜，略知其意，又不肯竟學。

translations.literal: Thereupon Xiang Liang then taught Ji military methods, Ji greatly happy, roughly knew its meaning, moreover not willing completely learn.
translations.idiomatic: He escaped and hid.

sentences.zh: 項梁嘗有櫟陽逮，乃請蘄獄掾曹咎書抵櫟陽獄掾司馬欣，以故事得已。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang once had Que Yang arrest, then requested Qi prison clerk Cao Jiu write reached Que Yang prison clerk Sima Xin, with former matters obtained end.
translations.idiomatic: When the First Emperor died, Xiang Ji was twenty-four years old.

sentences.zh: 項梁殺人，與籍避仇於吳中。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang killed person, with Ji avoided enemies at Wu Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: He lived at home as a commoner.

sentences.zh: 吳中賢士大夫皆出項梁下。

translations.literal: Wu Zhong worthy scholars grand masters all came out Xiang Liang below.
translations.idiomatic: He was over eight chi tall.

sentences.zh: 每吳中有大繇役及喪，項梁常為主辦，陰以兵法部勒賓客及子弟，以是知其能。

translations.literal: Every Wu Zhong had great labor service and mourning, Xiang Liang constantly was main manager, secretly with military methods organized guests and younger brothers, with this knew his ability.
translations.idiomatic: His strength could lift a cauldron.

sentences.zh: 秦始皇帝游會稽，渡浙江，梁與籍俱觀。

translations.literal: Qin Beginning Emperor toured Kui Ji, crossed Zhe Jiang, Liang with Ji together observed.
translations.idiomatic: His intelligence was outstanding among his peers.

sentences.zh: 籍曰：「彼可取而代也。」

translations.literal: Ji said: 'That can take and replace also.'
translations.idiomatic: He was generous and chivalrous.

sentences.zh: 梁掩其口，曰：「毋妄言，族矣！」

translations.literal: Liang covered his mouth, said: 'Not reckless speak, clan perished!'
translations.idiomatic: In the village of Xiaxiang, the elders respected him.

sentences.zh: 梁以此奇籍。

translations.literal: Liang with this considered Ji extraordinary.
translations.idiomatic: When the Second Emperor ascended, Chen Sheng and Wu Guang rose in rebellion.

sentences.zh: 籍長八尺餘，力能扛鼎，才氣過人，雖吳中子弟皆已憚籍矣。

translations.literal: Ji tall eight chi remainder, strength could lift tripod, talent spirit surpassed people, though Wu Zhong younger brothers all already feared Ji already.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked and took Zhu County.

translations.literal: When Xiang Ji was young, he studied writing but did not succeed. He left to study swordsmanship, but again did not succeed. Xiang Liang was angry with him. Ji said: 'Writing is sufficient only to record names and surnames. Swordsmanship fights one person enemy, not sufficient to learn. Learn to fight ten thousand people enemy.' Thereupon Xiang Liang taught Ji military methods. Ji was greatly happy, roughly knew its meaning, but moreover was not willing to completely learn. Xiang Liang once had a Queyang arrest warrant. He then requested the Qi prison clerk Cao Jiu to write a letter reaching the Queyang prison clerk Sima Xin, and with former matters obtained an end to it. Xiang Liang killed a person and with Ji avoided enemies in Wuzhong. All the worthy scholars and grand masters in Wuzhong came out below Xiang Liang. Whenever Wuzhong had great labor service or mourning, Xiang Liang was constantly the main manager. Secretly he organized the guests and younger brothers with military methods. With this they knew his ability. The Qin Beginning Emperor toured Kuiji and crossed the Zhejiang. Liang and Ji together observed. Ji said: 'That can be taken and replaced.' Liang covered his mouth, saying: 'Do not speak recklessly, the clan will perish!' Liang considered Ji extraordinary with this. Ji was tall over eight chi, had strength to lift a tripod, talent and spirit surpassed people. Though the younger brothers in Wuzhong all already feared Ji.

sentences.zh: 秦二世元年七月，陳涉等起大澤中。

translations.literal: Qin Second Generation first year seventh month, Chen She etc. rose great marsh middle.
translations.idiomatic: The world called them generals.

translations.literal: Its ninth month, Kui Ji governor Tong said to Liang: 'Jiang west all rebelled, this also heaven perished Qin time also.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang and Xiang Ji discussed.

sentences.zh: 吾聞先即制人，後則為人所制。

translations.literal: I heard first then control people, later then by people controlled.
translations.idiomatic: They said: "This is a good opportunity."

sentences.zh: 吾欲發兵，使公及桓楚將。」

translations.literal: I wish dispatch troops, make duke and Huan Chu general.'
translations.idiomatic: They raised troops in Wu.

translations.literal: This time Huan Chu fled in marsh middle.

translations.literal: Liang said: 'Huan Chu fled, people none know his place, only Ji knows it ear.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang appointed himself governor of Kuaiji.

sentences.zh: 梁乃出，誡籍持劍居外待。

translations.literal: Liang then went out, warned Ji hold sword dwell outside wait.
translations.idiomatic: He made Xiang Ji his lieutenant.

translations.literal: Liang again entered, with governor sat, said: 'Please summon Ji, make receive command summon Huan Chu.'
translations.idiomatic: They attacked and took Xiapi.

translations.literal: Governor said: 'Agreed.'
translations.idiomatic: They attacked and took Dongcheng.

translations.literal: Liang summoned Ji enter.

translations.literal: Moment, Liang winked Ji said: 'Can act already!'
translations.idiomatic: They attacked and took Chengqiu.

sentences.zh: 於是籍遂拔劍斬守頭。

translations.literal: Thereupon Ji then drew sword beheaded governor head.

translations.literal: Xiang Liang held governor head, wore his seal ribbons.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Sheng was defeated and fled.

sentences.zh: 門下大驚，擾亂，籍所擊殺數十百人。

translations.literal: Gate below greatly startled, disturbed chaotic, Ji what struck killed several ten hundred people.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang made him a general.

sentences.zh: 一府中皆慴伏，莫敢起。

translations.literal: One office middle all terrified submitted, none dared rise.
translations.idiomatic: He sent him to attack Dongyang.

sentences.zh: 梁乃召故所知豪吏，諭以所為起大事，遂舉吳中兵。

translations.literal: Liang then summoned formerly known heroic officials, explained with what did raise great matters, then raised Wu Zhong troops.
translations.idiomatic: He defeated the Qin army there.

sentences.zh: 使人收下縣，得精兵八千人。

translations.literal: Made people collect lower counties, obtained elite troops eight thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang heard this.

translations.literal: Liang deployed Wu Zhong heroic outstanding as company commanders, scouts, adjutants.

sentences.zh: 有一人不得用，自言於梁。

translations.literal: Had one person not obtained use, self spoke to Liang.
translations.idiomatic: He appointed Xiang Ji as the vanguard.

sentences.zh: 梁曰：「前時某喪使公主某事，不能辦，以此不任用公。」

translations.literal: Liang said: 'Former time certain mourning made you duke certain matters, could not manage, with this not employed you.'
translations.idiomatic: They attacked and took Cao County.

sentences.zh: 眾乃皆伏。

translations.literal: Crowd then all submitted.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked and took Dingtao.

sentences.zh: 於是梁為會稽守，籍為裨將，徇下縣。

translations.literal: Thereupon Liang was Kui Ji governor, Ji was assistant general, toured lower counties.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked and took Chengyang.

translations.literal: In Qin Second Generation's first year, seventh month, Chen She and others rose up in the great marsh. In the ninth month, the Kuiji governor Tong said to Liang: 'West of the Jiang all rebelled. This is also the time when heaven perishes Qin. I have heard: first then control people, later then be controlled by people. I wish to dispatch troops, make you and Huan Chu generals.' At this time, Huan Chu had fled in the marsh. Liang said: 'Huan Chu has fled. No one knows his place. Only Ji knows it.' Liang then went out and warned Ji to hold his sword and wait outside. Liang again entered and sat with the governor, saying: 'Please summon Ji to make him receive the command to summon Huan Chu.' The governor said: 'Agreed.' Liang summoned Ji to enter. In a moment, Liang winked at Ji, saying: 'Can act already!' Thereupon Ji drew his sword and beheaded the governor. Xiang Liang held the governor's head and wore his seal ribbons. Those below the gate were greatly startled and disturbed. Ji struck and killed several tens of people. Everyone in the office was terrified and submitted. None dared rise. Liang then summoned the heroic officials he formerly knew, explained what they were doing to raise great matters, and raised the Wuzhong troops. He had people collect from the lower counties and obtained eight thousand elite troops. Liang deployed the heroic outstanding men of Wuzhong as company commanders, scouts, and adjutants. There was one person who did not obtain use. He spoke to Liang himself. Liang said: 'In former times, a certain mourning made you duke handle certain matters. You could not manage them. With this I did not employ you.' The crowd then all submitted. Thereupon Liang became the Kuiji governor, Ji became assistant general, and toured the lower counties.

sentences.zh: 廣陵人召平於是為陳王徇廣陵，未能下。

translations.literal: Guang Ling person Zhao Ping at this for Chen king toured Guang Ling, not yet able submit.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked and took Yuanqiu.

translations.literal: Said: 'Jiang east already settled, urgently lead troops west strike Qin.'

translations.literal: Xiang Liang then with eight thousand people crossed Jiang west.

translations.literal: Heard Chen Ying already submitted Dong Yang, made envoy wished with connect harmony together west.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Ji was brave and fierce in battle.

translations.literal: Chen Ying one, former Dong Yang magistrate secretary, resided county middle, originally trustworthy careful, called elder.
translations.idiomatic: No one could withstand him.

sentences.zh: 東陽少年殺其令，相聚數千人，欲置長，無適用，乃請陳嬰。

translations.literal: Dong Yang youths killed their magistrate, mutually gathered several thousand people, wished establish leader, none suitable applied, then requested Chen Ying.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu army feared him like a god.

sentences.zh: 嬰謝不能，遂彊立嬰為長，縣中從者得二萬人。

translations.literal: Ying declined could not, then strongly established Ying as leader, county middle followers obtained twenty thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Xiang Liang had several thousand followers.

sentences.zh: 少年欲立嬰便為王，異軍蒼頭特起。

translations.literal: Youths wished establish Ying then as king, different army dark heads specially rose.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong attacked Xiang Liang.

sentences.zh: 陳嬰母謂嬰曰：「自我為汝家婦，未嘗聞汝先古之有貴者。

translations.literal: Chen Ying mother said to Ying: 'From I became your family woman, never heard your ancestors had noble ones.
translations.idiomatic: He killed Xiang Liang at Dingtao.

sentences.zh: 今暴得大名，不祥。

translations.literal: Now suddenly obtained great name, not auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: To suddenly gain such great fame now would be inauspicious.

sentences.zh: 不如有所屬，事成猶得封侯，事敗易以亡，非世所指名也。」

translations.literal: Not as good as have belonging, matters succeed still obtain enfeoff marquis, matters fail easy to flee, not world what points name also.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to have someone else take the throne. If we succeed, I can still be enfeoffed as a marquis. If we fail, I can easily flee. The world will not point to me by name."

sentences.zh: 嬰乃不敢為王。

translations.literal: Ying then not dared be king.
translations.idiomatic: Ying therefore dared not become king.

sentences.zh: 謂其軍吏曰：「項氏世世將家，有名於楚。

translations.literal: Said to his army officials: 'Xiang clan generation generation general family, had name in Chu.
translations.idiomatic: With the armies of Chu, Xiang, and Han attacking Qin, they destroyed its armies, executed its general Zhang Han, and drove the Qin forces back.

sentences.zh: 今欲舉大事，將非其人，不可。

translations.literal: Now wish raise great matters, general not its person, not possible.
translations.idiomatic: They advanced to the Hangu Pass but did not enter.

sentences.zh: 我倚名族，亡秦必矣。」

translations.literal: I rely famous clan, perish Qin certainly already.'
translations.idiomatic: The Qin court was greatly alarmed.

sentences.zh: 於是眾從其言，以兵屬項梁。

translations.literal: Thereupon crowd followed his words, with troops belonged Xiang Liang.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor summoned Lord Gao and asked: "What should we do?"

sentences.zh: 項梁渡淮，黥布、蒲將軍亦以兵屬焉。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang crossed Huai, Qing Bu, Pu general also with troops attached there.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Gao said: "The passes and defenses are strong. The army cannot advance further.

sentences.zh: 凡六七萬人，軍下邳。

translations.literal: Altogether six seven ten thousand people, stationed Xia Pi.
translations.idiomatic: The world has long been resentful. Now the six states have risen together. Their soldiers are strong and their generals skilled. Even if we have a million men, we cannot hold out.

translations.literal: The Guangling person Zhao Ping at this time toured Guangling for the Chen king, but was not yet able to submit it. He heard the Chen king was defeated and fled, Qin troops moreover were about to arrive. He then crossed the Jiang, forged the Chen king's command, and appointed Liang as Chu king supreme pillar of state. He said: 'Jiang east is already settled. Urgently lead troops west to strike Qin.' Xiang Liang then with eight thousand people crossed the Jiang westward. He heard Chen Ying had already submitted Dongyang. He sent an envoy wishing to connect in harmony and go west together. Chen Ying was a former Dongyang magistrate's secretary. He resided in the county, was originally trustworthy and careful, called an elder. The Dongyang youths killed their magistrate, mutually gathered several thousand people. They wished to establish a leader. None was suitable. They then requested Chen Ying. Ying declined he could not. They then strongly established Ying as leader. The county followers obtained twenty thousand people. The youths wished to establish Ying directly as king, with different army dark heads specially rising. Chen Ying's mother said to Ying: 'Since I became your family's woman, I have never heard that your ancestors had noble ones. Now you have suddenly obtained a great name. This is not auspicious. It is not as good as having a belonging. If matters succeed, you can still obtain enfeoffment as marquis. If matters fail, it is easy to flee. You will not be what the world points to by name.' Ying then did not dare to be king. He said to his army officials: 'The Xiang clan is generation after generation a general's family, has name in Chu. Now we wish to raise great matters. If the general is not the right person, it is not possible. I rely on the famous clan. Perishing Qin is certain.' Thereupon the crowd followed his words and attached their troops to Xiang Liang. Xiang Liang crossed the Huai. Qing Bu and General Pu also attached their troops there. Altogether sixty to seventy thousand people, stationed at Xiapi.

sentences.zh: 當是時，秦嘉已立景駒為楚王，軍彭城東，欲距項梁。

translations.literal: At this time, Qin Jia already established Jing Ju as Chu king, stationed Peng Cheng east, wished resist Xiang Liang.
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to divide the empire and make peace with them. Make the western mountains our border, and divide the land east of the mountains among the six states. Then we can live in peace."

sentences.zh: 項梁謂軍吏曰：「陳王先首事，戰不利，未聞所在。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang said to army officials: 'Chen king first began matters, battle unfavorable, not heard location.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor agreed to this.

sentences.zh: 今秦嘉倍陳王而立景駒，逆無道。」

translations.literal: Now Qin Jia rebelled Chen king established Jing Ju, perverse without way.'
translations.idiomatic: He sent Lord Gao to make peace with the Chu army.

sentences.zh: 乃進兵擊秦嘉。

translations.literal: Then advanced troops struck Qin Jia.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Gao said to Xiang Liang: "As for dividing the empire and making peace, the western mountains will be Qin's border."

sentences.zh: 秦嘉軍敗走，追之至胡陵。

translations.literal: Qin Jia army defeated fled, pursued him to Hu Ling.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang agreed.

sentences.zh: 嘉還戰一日，嘉死，軍降。

translations.literal: Jia returned battled one day, Jia died, army surrendered.
translations.idiomatic: He returned and reported to the Second Emperor.

sentences.zh: 景駒走死梁地。

translations.literal: Jing Ju fled died Liang land.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor was greatly pleased.

sentences.zh: 項梁已并秦嘉軍，軍胡陵，將引軍而西。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang already united Qin Jia army, stationed Hu Ling, would lead army west.
translations.idiomatic: He made Lord Gao a marquis and sent him back to negotiate the treaty.

sentences.zh: 章邯軍至栗，項梁使別將朱雞石、餘樊君與戰。

translations.literal: Zhang Han army arrived Li, Xiang Liang made separate generals Zhu Ji Shi, Yu Fan Jun with battle.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Gao returned to the army and told Xiang Liang: "The Second Emperor has agreed to divide the empire."

sentences.zh: 餘樊君死。

translations.literal: Yu Fan Jun died.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang was overjoyed.

sentences.zh: 朱雞石軍敗，亡走胡陵。

translations.literal: Zhu Ji Shi army defeated, fled went Hu Ling.
translations.idiomatic: He told the various generals: "The Qin court is now terrified.

sentences.zh: 項梁乃引兵入薛，誅雞石。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang then led troops entered Xue, executed Ji Shi.
translations.idiomatic: They have agreed to divide the empire. The western mountains will be their border."

sentences.zh: 項梁前使項羽別攻襄城，襄城堅守不下。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang previously made Xiang Yu separately attack Xiang Cheng, Xiang Cheng firmly guarded not submitted.
translations.idiomatic: The generals all said: "Excellent!"

sentences.zh: 已拔，皆阬之。

translations.literal: Already pulled, all pitted them.
translations.idiomatic: Only Xiang Yu was furious. He said: "We came to destroy Qin!

sentences.zh: 還報項梁。

translations.literal: Returned reported Xiang Liang.
translations.idiomatic: Why divide the empire with them?"

sentences.zh: 項梁聞陳王定死，召諸別將會薛計事。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang heard Chen king certainly died, summoned various separate generals assembled Xue planned matters.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang said: "The multitudes say Qin cannot be attacked.

sentences.zh: 此時沛公亦起沛，往焉。

translations.literal: This time Pei gong also rose Pei, went there.
translations.idiomatic: If we can get them to divide the empire, that is already good."

translations.literal: At this time, Qin Jia had already established Jing Ju as Chu king, stationed east of Pengcheng, wishing to resist Xiang Liang. Xiang Liang said to the army officials: 'The Chen king first began the matters. The battle was unfavorable. We have not heard his location. Now Qin Jia has rebelled against the Chen king and established Jing Ju. This is perverse and without way.' He then advanced troops to strike Qin Jia. Qin Jia's army was defeated and fled. They pursued him to Huling. Jia returned and battled for one day. Jia died. The army surrendered. Jing Ju fled and died in Liang territory. Xiang Liang had already united with Qin Jia's army, stationed at Huling, and would lead the army westward. Zhang Han's army arrived at Li. Xiang Liang had separate generals Zhu Jishi and Yu Fanjun battle them. Yu Fanjun died. Zhu Jishi's army was defeated and fled to Huling. Xiang Liang then led troops into Xue and executed Jishi. Xiang Liang had previously made Xiang Yu separately attack Xiangcheng. Xiangcheng firmly guarded and did not submit. When it was already captured, he pitted them all. He returned and reported to Xiang Liang. Xiang Liang heard the Chen king had certainly died. He summoned the various separate generals to assemble at Xue and plan matters. At this time, Pei Gong also rose at Pei and went there.

sentences.zh: 居鄛人范增，年七十，素居家，好奇計，往說項梁曰：「陳勝敗碧當。

translations.literal: Ju Ju person Fan Zeng, age seventy, originally resided home, liked strange plans, went persuaded Xiang Liang said: 'Chen Sheng defeated should.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said: "Those who contend for the world, what need do they have for allies?

sentences.zh: 夫秦滅六國，楚最無罪。

translations.literal: Husband Qin extinguished six states, Chu most without crime.
translations.idiomatic: What need for dividing territory?

sentences.zh: 自懷王入秦不反，楚人憐之至今，故楚南公曰『楚雖三戶，亡秦必楚』也。

translations.literal: From Huai wang entered Qin not returned, Chu people pitied him until now, therefore Chu Nan gong said 'Chu though three households, perish Qin certainly Chu' also.
translations.idiomatic: To destroy their state and execute their ruler—this is what we came for!"

sentences.zh: 今陳勝首事，不立楚後而自立，其勢不長。

translations.literal: Now Chen Sheng first began matters, not established Chu descendants but self established, his situation not long.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang thought Xiang Yu was right but feared the multitudes.

sentences.zh: 今君起江東，楚蜂午之將皆爭附君者，以君世世楚將，為能復立楚之後也。」

translations.literal: Now lord rose Jiang east, Chu swarming generals all contended attached lord ones, because lord generation generation Chu generals, able to again establish Chu descendants also.'
translations.idiomatic: He secretly sent people to assassinate Lord Gao.

sentences.zh: 於是項梁然其言，乃求楚懷王孫心民閒，為人牧羊，立以為楚懷王，從民所望也。

translations.literal: Thereupon Xiang Liang approved his words, then sought Chu Huai wang grandson Xin among people, was person herding sheep, established him as Chu Huai wang, followed people what hoped also.
translations.idiomatic: They killed him in the toilet.

sentences.zh: 陳嬰為楚上柱國，封五縣，與懷王都盱臺。

translations.literal: Chen Ying was Chu supreme pillar state, enfeoffed five counties, with Huai wang capital Xu Tai.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang said: "Lord Gao was killed by bandits."

sentences.zh: 項梁自號為武信君。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang self titled Martial Faith lord.
translations.idiomatic: He sent people to report to the Second Emperor: "Lord Gao has been killed by bandits."

translations.literal: The Juju person Fan Zeng, age seventy, originally resided at home and liked strange plans. He went to persuade Xiang Liang, saying: 'Chen Sheng's defeat should. Qin extinguished the six states. Chu was most without crime. Since King Huai entered Qin and did not return, the Chu people have pitied him until now. Therefore Chu Nangong said 'Though Chu has only three households, perishing Qin will certainly be Chu.' Now Chen Sheng first began the matters but did not establish Chu descendants and self-established. His situation will not be long. Now you, my lord, rose in Jiangdong. All the Chu generals like swarming bees contend to attach to you, because you are generation after generation Chu generals, able to again establish Chu descendants.' Thereupon Xiang Liang approved his words. He then sought Chu King Huai's grandson Xin among the people. He was a person herding sheep. He established him as Chu King Huai, following what the people hoped. Chen Ying became Chu supreme pillar of state, enfeoffed five counties, and with King Huai made the capital Xutai. Xiang Liang self-titled as Lord Martial Faith.

sentences.zh: 居數月，引兵攻亢父，與齊田榮、司馬龍且軍救東阿，大破秦軍於東阿。

translations.literal: Resided several months, led troops attacked Kang Fu, with Qi Tian Rong, Sima Long Ju army rescued Dong E, greatly broke Qin army at Dong E.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor was furious. He said: "The Chu people killed my envoy!"

sentences.zh: 田榮即引兵歸，逐其王假。

translations.literal: Tian Rong immediately led troops returned, expelled their king Jia.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Zhang Han to attack Chu.

sentences.zh: 假亡走楚。

translations.literal: Jia fled went Chu.
translations.idiomatic: The battle was joined at Dingtao.

sentences.zh: 假相田角亡走趙。

translations.literal: Jia chancellor Tian Jiao fled went Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin army defeated Chu and killed Xiang Liang.

sentences.zh: 角弟田閒故齊將，居趙不敢歸。

translations.literal: Jiao younger brother Tian Jian former Qi general, resided Zhao not dared return.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu and his uncle Xiang Bo fled east.

sentences.zh: 田榮立田儋子市為齊王。

translations.literal: Tian Rong established Tian Dan son Shi as Qi king.
translations.idiomatic: They crossed the river and went to Wu.

sentences.zh: 項梁已破東阿下軍，遂追秦軍。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang already defeated Dong E lower army, then pursued Qin army.
translations.idiomatic: They gathered the scattered soldiers and stopped at Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 數使使趣齊兵，欲與俱西。

translations.literal: Several times sent envoys urged Qi troops, wished with them together west.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Chen Ying heard that Xiang Liang was dead.

sentences.zh: 田榮曰：「楚殺田假，趙殺田角、田閒，乃發兵。」

translations.literal: Tian Rong said: 'Chu killed Tian Jia, Zhao killed Tian Jiao, Tian Jian, then send troops.'
translations.idiomatic: He thought Chu was now weak.

sentences.zh: 項梁曰：「田假為與國之王，窮來從我，不忍殺之。」

translations.literal: Xiang Liang said: 'Tian Jia was allied state king, destitute came followed me, not bear to kill him.'
translations.idiomatic: He secretly sent people to assassinate Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 趙亦不殺田角、田閒以市於齊。

translations.literal: Zhao also not killed Tian Jiao, Tian Jian to bargain with Qi.
translations.idiomatic: The assassin came to Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 齊遂不肯發兵助楚。

translations.literal: Qi then not willing to send troops help Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu captured and killed him.

sentences.zh: 項梁使沛公及項羽別攻城陽，屠之。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang made Pei Gong and Xiang Yu separately attack Chengyang, slaughtered it.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Ying was terrified.

sentences.zh: 西破秦軍濮陽東，秦兵收入濮陽。

translations.literal: West defeated Qin army Puyang east, Qin troops withdrew into Puyang.
translations.idiomatic: He fled to Wei and made himself king of Wei.

sentences.zh: 沛公、項羽乃攻定陶。

translations.literal: Pei Gong, Xiang Yu then attacked Ding Tao.
translations.idiomatic: When Xiang Yu heard this, he said: "I will attack Wei first."

sentences.zh: 定陶未下，去，西略地至雝丘，大破秦軍，斬李由。

translations.literal: Ding Tao not fallen, left, west raided territory to Yong Qiu, greatly defeated Qin army, beheaded Li You.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Chen Ying and captured him.

sentences.zh: 還攻外黃，外黃未下。

translations.literal: Returned attacked Wai Huang, Wai Huang not fallen.
translations.idiomatic: Returned attacked Wai Huang, Wai Huang not fallen. (translated).

translations.literal: He resided several months, led troops to attack Kangfu, and with Qi's Tian Rong and Sima Longju's army rescued Dong'e. They greatly broke the Qin army at Dong'e. Tian Rong immediately led troops back and expelled their king Jia. Jia fled to Chu. Jia's chancellor Tian Jiao fled to Zhao. Jiao's younger brother Tian Jian was a former Qi general. He resided in Zhao and did not dare return. Tian Rong established Tian Dan's son Shi as Qi king. Xiang Liang, having already defeated the Dong'e garrison, then pursued the Qin army. He repeatedly sent envoys to urge Qi troops, wishing to advance west together with them. Tian Rong said: 'Chu killed Tian Jia, Zhao killed Tian Jiao and Tian Jian. Only then will we send troops.' Xiang Liang said: 'Tian Jia was king of an allied state. He came to me destitute and loyal. I cannot bear to kill him.' Zhao also spared Tian Jiao and Tian Jian to use as bargaining chips with Qi. Qi then refused to send troops to help Chu. Xiang Liang sent Liu Bang and Xiang Yu to separately attack Chengyang and put it to the slaughter. To the west, they defeated the Qin army east of Puyang. The Qin troops withdrew into Puyang. Liu Bang and Xiang Yu then attacked Dingtao. Dingtao did not fall. They left and raided west to Yongqiu, where they greatly defeated the Qin army and beheaded Li You. They returned to attack Waihuang, but Waihuang did not fall.

sentences.zh: 項梁起東阿，西，（北）［比］至定陶，再破秦軍，項羽等又斬李由，益輕秦，有驕色。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang rose Dong E, west, reached Ding Tao, again defeated Qin army, Xiang Yu etc. again beheaded Li You, increasingly despised Qin, had arrogant appearance.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang rose Dong E, west, reached Ding Tao, again defeated Qin army, Xiang Yu etc. again beheaded Li You, increasingly despised Qin, had arrogant appearance. (translated).

sentences.zh: 宋義乃諫項梁曰：「戰勝而將驕卒惰者敗。

translations.literal: Song Yi then admonished Xiang Liang said: 'Battle victory and general arrogant troops lazy ones fail.
translations.idiomatic: Song Yi then admonished Xiang Liang said: 'Battle victory and general arrogant troops lazy ones fail. (translated).

sentences.zh: 今卒少惰矣，秦兵日益，臣為君畏之。」

translations.literal: Now troops already lazy, Qin troops daily increasing, minister for lord fear it.'
translations.idiomatic: Now troops already lazy, Qin troops daily increasing, minister for lord fear it.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項梁弗聽。

translations.literal: Xiang Liang not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang not listen. (translated).

sentences.zh: 乃使宋義使於齊。

translations.literal: Then made Song Yi envoy to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Then made Song Yi envoy to Qi. (translated).

sentences.zh: 道遇齊使者高陵君顯，曰：「公將見武信君乎？」

translations.literal: On road met Qi envoy Gao Ling Jun Xian, said: 'Sir will see Wu Xin Jun?'
translations.idiomatic: On road met Qi envoy Gao Ling Jun Xian, said: 'Sir will see Wu Xin Jun?' (translated).

translations.literal: Said: 'Yes.'
translations.idiomatic: Said: 'Yes.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 曰：「臣論武信君軍必敗。

translations.literal: Said: 'Minister views Wu Xin Jun army must defeat.
translations.idiomatic: Said: 'Minister views Wu Xin Jun army must defeat. (translated).

sentences.zh: 公徐行即免死，疾行則及禍。」

translations.literal: Sir slow travel then avoid death, fast travel then reach calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: Sir slow travel then avoid death, fast travel then reach calamity.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 秦果悉起兵益章邯，擊楚軍，大破之定陶，項梁死。

translations.literal: Qin indeed all raised troops reinforced Zhang Han, struck Chu army, greatly defeated it Ding Tao, Xiang Liang died.
translations.idiomatic: Qin indeed all raised troops reinforced Zhang Han, struck Chu army, greatly defeated it Ding Tao, Xiang Liang died. (translated).

sentences.zh: 沛公、項羽去外黃攻陳留，陳留堅守不能下。

translations.literal: Pei Gong, Xiang Yu left Wai Huang attacked Chen Liu, Chen Liu firmly defended could not take.
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong, Xiang Yu left Wai Huang attacked Chen Liu, Chen Liu firmly defended could not take. (translated).

sentences.zh: 沛公、項羽相與謀曰：「今項梁軍破，士卒恐。」

translations.literal: Pei Gong, Xiang Yu mutually plotted said: 'Now Xiang Liang army broken, soldiers fear.'
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong, Xiang Yu mutually plotted said: 'Now Xiang Liang army broken, soldiers fear.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 乃與呂臣軍俱引兵而東。

translations.literal: Then with Lü Chen army together led troops and east.
translations.idiomatic: Then with Lü Chen army together led troops and east. (translated).

sentences.zh: 呂臣軍彭城東，項羽軍彭城西，沛公軍碭。

translations.literal: Lü Chen army Pengcheng east, Xiang Yu army Pengcheng west, Pei Gong army Dang.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Chen army Pengcheng east, Xiang Yu army Pengcheng west, Pei Gong army Dang. (translated).

translations.literal: Xiang Liang rose from Dong'e, went west, and reached Dingtao. He again defeated the Qin army. Xiang Yu and others again beheaded Li You. He increasingly despised Qin and showed an arrogant demeanor. Song Yi then admonished Xiang Liang, saying: 'Generals who grow arrogant and troops who grow lazy after victory are doomed to defeat. Our troops are already growing lazy. Qin's forces are increasing daily. Your minister fears this for you.' Xiang Liang did not listen. He then sent Song Yi as an envoy to Qi. On the road, he met the Qi envoy Lord Gaoling Xian, who said: 'Sir, are you going to see Lord Wuxin?' He said: 'Yes.' He said: 'In my minister's view, Lord Wuxin's army is certain to be defeated. If you travel slowly, sir, you will avoid death. If you travel quickly, you will meet with calamity.' Qin indeed mobilized all their troops to reinforce Zhang Han. They struck the Chu army and greatly defeated it at Dingtao. Xiang Liang died. Liu Bang and Xiang Yu left Waihuang to attack Chenliu, but Chenliu defended firmly and could not be taken. Liu Bang and Xiang Yu conferred together and said: 'Now Xiang Liang's army has been broken. The soldiers are terrified.' They then led their troops east together with Lü Chen's army. Lü Chen's army was east of Pengcheng, Xiang Yu's army west of Pengcheng, Liu Bang's army at Dang.

sentences.zh: 章邯已破項梁軍，則以為楚地兵不足憂，乃渡河擊趙，大破之。

translations.literal: Zhang Han already defeated Xiang Liang army, then considered Chu land troops not worth worrying, then crossed river struck Zhao, greatly defeated it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han already defeated Xiang Liang army, then considered Chu land troops not worth worrying, then crossed river struck Zhao, greatly defeated it. (translated).

sentences.zh: 當此時，趙歇為王，陳餘為將，張耳為相，皆走入鉅鹿城。

translations.literal: At this time, Zhao Xie was king, Chen Yu was general, Zhang Er was chancellor, all fled entered Ju Lu city.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Zhao Xie was king, Chen Yu was general, Zhang Er was chancellor, all fled entered Ju Lu city. (translated).

sentences.zh: 章邯令王離、涉閒圍鉅鹿，章邯軍其南，筑甬道而輸之粟。

translations.literal: Zhang Han ordered Wang Li, She Jian surrounded Ju Lu, Zhang Han army its south, built covered walkway and transported grain to them.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han ordered Wang Li, She Jian surrounded Ju Lu, Zhang Han army its south, built covered walkway and transported grain to them. (translated).

sentences.zh: 陳餘為將，將卒數萬人而軍鉅鹿之北，此所謂河北之軍也。

translations.literal: Chen Yu was general, led troops several ten thousand people and army Ju Lu north, this called Hebei army.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu was general, led troops several ten thousand people and army Ju Lu north, this called Hebei army. (translated).

translations.literal: Zhang Han, having already defeated Xiang Liang's army, then considered Chu's troops no longer worth worrying about. He crossed the river to strike Zhao and greatly defeated them. At this time, Zhao Xie was king, Chen Yu was general, Zhang Er was chancellor. They all fled into Julu city. Zhang Han ordered Wang Li and She Jian to surround Julu. Zhang Han's army was to the south. He built a covered walkway to transport grain to them. Chen Yu was the general, leading tens of thousands of troops stationed north of Julu. This was the so-called Army North of the River.

sentences.zh: 楚兵已破於定陶，懷王恐，從盱臺之彭城，并項羽、呂臣軍自將之。

translations.literal: Chu troops already defeated at Ding Tao, Huai Wang feared, from Xu Tai to Pengcheng, combined Xiang Yu, Lü Chen army personally led them.
translations.idiomatic: Chu troops already defeated at Ding Tao, Huai Wang feared, from Xu Tai to Pengcheng, combined Xiang Yu, Lü Chen army personally led them. (translated).

sentences.zh: 以呂臣為司徒，以其父呂青為令尹。

translations.literal: Made Lü Chen Minister of Justice, made his father Lü Qing Prime Minister.
translations.idiomatic: Made Lü Chen Minister of Justice, made his father Lü Qing Prime Minister. (translated).

sentences.zh: 以沛公為碭郡長，封為武安侯，將碭郡兵。

translations.literal: Made Pei Gong Dang commandery governor, enfeoffed as Wu An Hou, led Dang commandery troops.
translations.idiomatic: Made Pei Gong Dang commandery governor, enfeoffed as Wu An Hou, led Dang commandery troops. (translated).

translations.literal: Chu's troops had already been defeated at Dingtao. King Huai grew fearful. He moved from Xutai to Pengcheng and personally took command of Xiang Yu and Lü Chen's combined armies. He appointed Lü Chen as Minister of Justice and his father Lü Qing as Prime Minister. He appointed Liu Bang as governor of Dang commandery, enfeoffed him as Marquis of Wuan, and put him in command of Dang commandery's troops.

sentences.zh: 初，宋義所遇齊使者高陵君顯在楚軍，見楚王曰：「宋義論武信君之軍必敗，居數日，軍果敗。

translations.literal: Initially, Song Yi encountered Qi envoy Gao Ling Jun Xian in Chu army, saw Chu king said: 'Song Yi viewed Wu Xin Jun army must defeat, stayed several days, army indeed defeated.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Song Yi encountered Qi envoy Gao Ling Jun Xian in Chu army, saw Chu king said: 'Song Yi viewed Wu Xin Jun army must defeat, stayed several days, army indeed defeated. (translated).

sentences.zh: 兵未戰而先見敗徵，此可謂知兵矣。」

translations.literal: Troops not yet fought and first saw defeat omens, this can be called knowing troops.'
translations.idiomatic: Troops not yet fought and first saw defeat omens, this can be called knowing troops.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 王召宋義與計事而大說之，因置以為上將軍，項羽為魯公，為次將，范增為末將，救趙。

translations.literal: King summoned Song Yi with discussed matters and greatly pleased him, therefore appointed him as supreme general, Xiang Yu as Lu Gong, as deputy general, Fan Zeng as rear general, rescued Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: King summoned Song Yi with discussed matters and greatly pleased him, therefore appointed him as supreme general, Xiang Yu as Lu Gong, as deputy general, Fan Zeng as rear general, rescued Zhao. (translated).

sentences.zh: 諸別將皆屬宋義，號為卿子冠軍。

translations.literal: All other generals all belonged to Song Yi, titled Qing Zi Champion.
translations.idiomatic: All other generals all belonged to Song Yi, titled Qing Zi Champion. (translated).

sentences.zh: 行至安陽，留四十六日不進。

translations.literal: Marched to An Yang, stayed forty-six days not advanced.
translations.idiomatic: Marched to An Yang, stayed forty-six days not advanced. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項羽曰：「吾聞秦軍圍趙王鉅鹿，疾引兵渡河，楚擊其外，趙應其內，破秦軍必矣。」

translations.literal: Xiang Yu said: 'I heard Qin army surrounds Zhao king Ju Lu, quickly lead troops cross river, Chu strike its outside, Zhao respond its inside, break Qin army certain.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said: 'I heard Qin army surrounds Zhao king Ju Lu, quickly lead troops cross river, Chu strike its outside, Zhao respond its inside, break Qin army certain.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 宋義曰：「不然。

translations.literal: Song Yi said: 'Not so.
translations.idiomatic: Song Yi said: 'Not so. (translated).

sentences.zh: 夫搏牛之虻不可以破蟣虱。

translations.literal: Now fighting ox horseflies not possible break lice ticks.
translations.idiomatic: Now fighting ox horseflies not possible break lice ticks. (translated).

sentences.zh: 今秦攻趙，戰勝則兵罷，我承其敝；

translations.literal: Now Qin attacks Zhao, battle victory then troops weary, we inherit their fatigue;
translations.idiomatic: Now Qin attacks Zhao, battle victory then troops weary, we inherit their fatigue; (translated).

sentences.zh: 不勝，則我引兵鼓行而西，必舉秦矣。

translations.literal: Not victorious, then we lead troops beating drums west, must take Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Not victorious, then we lead troops beating drums west, must take Qin. (translated).

sentences.zh: 故不如先鬬秦趙。

translations.literal: Therefore better than first let fight Qin Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore better than first let fight Qin Zhao. (translated).

sentences.zh: 夫被堅執銳，義不如公；

translations.literal: Now wearing armor wielding sharp weapons, Yi not as good as you;
translations.idiomatic: Now wearing armor wielding sharp weapons, Yi not as good as you; (translated).

sentences.zh: 坐而運策，公不如義。」

translations.literal: Sitting and directing strategy, you not as good as Yi.'
translations.idiomatic: Sitting and directing strategy, you not as good as Yi.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 因下令軍中曰：「猛如虎，很如羊，貪如狼，彊不可使者，皆斬之。」

translations.literal: Therefore issued order army middle said: 'Fierce like tiger, stubborn like sheep, greedy like wolf, strong not possible use, all behead them.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore issued order army middle said: 'Fierce like tiger, stubborn like sheep, greedy like wolf, strong not possible use, all behead them.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 乃遣其子宋襄相齊，身送之至無鹽，飲酒高會。

translations.literal: Then sent his son Song Xiang prime minister Qi, personally escorted him to Wu Yan, drank wine grand gatherings.
translations.idiomatic: Then sent his son Song Xiang prime minister Qi, personally escorted him to Wu Yan, drank wine grand gatherings. (translated).

sentences.zh: 天寒大雨，士卒凍饑。

translations.literal: Heaven cold heavy rain, soldiers froze hunger.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven cold heavy rain, soldiers froze hunger. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項羽曰：「將戮力而攻秦，久留不行。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu said: 'Will unite strength attack Qin, long stay not go.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said: 'Will unite strength attack Qin, long stay not go. (translated).

sentences.zh: 今歲饑民貧，士卒食芋菽，軍無見糧，乃飲酒高會，不引兵渡河因趙食，與趙并力攻秦，乃曰『承其敝』。

translations.literal: Now year famine people poor, soldiers eat taro beans, army no visible grain, instead drinks wine grand gatherings, not leads troops cross river rely on Zhao food, with Zhao combine strength attack Qin, instead says 'inherit their fatigue'.
translations.idiomatic: Now year famine people poor, soldiers eat taro beans, army no visible grain, instead drinks wine grand gatherings, not leads troops cross river rely on Zhao food, with Zhao combine strength attack Qin, instead says 'inherit their fatigue'. (translated).

sentences.zh: 夫以秦之彊，攻新造之趙，其勢必舉趙。

translations.literal: Now with Qin's strength, attacking newly made Zhao, its momentum must take Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Now with Qin's strength, attacking newly made Zhao, its momentum must take Zhao. (translated).

sentences.zh: 趙舉而秦彊，何敝之承！

translations.literal: Zhao taken and Qin strong, what fatigue to inherit!
translations.idiomatic: Zhao taken and Qin strong, what fatigue to inherit! (translated).

sentences.zh: 且國兵新破，王坐不安席，埽境內而專屬於將軍，國家安危，在此一舉。

translations.literal: Moreover state troops newly broken, king sits not at ease, sweeps within borders and exclusively belongs to general, state's safety danger, in this one action.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover state troops newly broken, king sits not at ease, sweeps within borders and exclusively belongs to general, state's safety danger, in this one action. (translated).

sentences.zh: 今不恤士卒而徇其私，非社稷之臣。」

translations.literal: Now not pity soldiers and follow his private interests, not state altars minister.'
translations.idiomatic: Now not pity soldiers and follow his private interests, not state altars minister.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項羽晨朝上將軍宋義，即其帳中斬宋義頭，出令軍中曰：「宋義與齊謀反楚，楚王陰令羽誅之。」

translations.literal: Xiang Yu morning audience supreme general Song Yi, immediately in his tent beheaded Song Yi head, issued order army middle said: 'Song Yi with Qi plotted rebel Chu, Chu king secretly ordered Yu execute him.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu morning audience supreme general Song Yi, immediately in his tent beheaded Song Yi head, issued order army middle said: 'Song Yi with Qi plotted rebel Chu, Chu king secretly ordered Yu execute him.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 當是時，諸將皆慴服，莫敢枝梧。

translations.literal: At this time, various generals all trembled submitted, none dared oppose.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, various generals all trembled submitted, none dared oppose. (translated).

sentences.zh: 皆曰：「首立楚者，將軍家也。

translations.literal: All said: 'First established Chu, general's family.
translations.idiomatic: All said: 'First established Chu, general's family. (translated).

sentences.zh: 今將軍誅亂。」

translations.literal: Now general executes chaos.'
translations.idiomatic: Now general executes chaos.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 乃相與共立羽為假上將軍。

translations.literal: Then mutually together established Yu as acting supreme general.
translations.idiomatic: Then mutually together established Yu as acting supreme general. (translated).

sentences.zh: 使人追宋義子，及之齊，殺之。

translations.literal: Made people pursue Song Yi son, reached him Qi, killed him.
translations.idiomatic: Made people pursue Song Yi son, reached him Qi, killed him. (translated).

sentences.zh: 使桓楚報命於懷王。

translations.literal: Made Huan Chu report command to Huai Wang.
translations.idiomatic: They sent Huan Chu to report the command to King Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷王因使項羽為上將軍，當陽君、蒲將軍皆屬項羽。

translations.literal: Huai Wang therefore made Xiang Yu supreme general, Dangyang Jun, Pu general all belonged to Xiang Yu.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai therefore made Xiang Yu supreme general. Lord Dangyang and General Pu all came under Xiang Yu.

translations.literal: Initially, the Qi envoy Lord Gaoling Xian whom Song Yi had encountered was in the Chu army. He saw the Chu king and said: 'Song Yi predicted that Lord Wuxin's army would certainly be defeated. Several days later, the army was indeed defeated. He foresaw the signs of defeat before the troops even fought. This can be called true knowledge of warfare.' The king summoned Song Yi to discuss matters and was greatly pleased with him. Therefore he appointed him as supreme general, Xiang Yu as Duke of Lu and deputy general, Fan Zeng as rear general, to rescue Zhao. All the other generals were subordinated to Song Yi, who was titled Champion Marquis. They marched to Anyang but stayed there forty-six days without advancing. Xiang Yu said: 'I hear that Qin's army is surrounding King Zhao at Julu. We should quickly lead our troops across the river. Chu will strike from the outside, Zhao will respond from the inside. Breaking Qin's army is certain.' Song Yi said: 'Not so. One cannot defeat lice and ticks by fighting horseflies on an ox. Now Qin is attacking Zhao. If they win, their troops will be weary. We can inherit their exhaustion; If they don't win, then we lead our troops beating drums westward and will certainly take Qin. Therefore it is better to first let Qin and Zhao fight each other. When it comes to wearing armor and wielding sharp weapons, I am not as good as you; But when it comes to sitting and directing strategy, you are not as good as I.' Therefore he issued an order in the army saying: 'Those fierce as tigers, stubborn as sheep, greedy as wolves, who are strong but cannot be used—all shall be beheaded.' He then sent his son Song Xiang as prime minister of Qi. He personally escorted him to Wuyan and held grand drinking parties. The weather was bitterly cold with heavy rain. The soldiers were freezing and starving. Xiang Yu said: 'We are supposed to unite our strength to attack Qin, but we stay here for a long time without moving. This year brings famine and poverty to the people. Our soldiers eat only taros and beans. The army has no visible stores of grain. Yet he drinks wine and holds grand gatherings. He doesn't lead troops across the river to rely on Zhao's food supplies and combine forces with Zhao to attack Qin. Instead he says 'inherit their fatigue'. Given Qin's strength attacking the newly established Zhao, their momentum will certainly take Zhao. If Zhao falls and Qin remains strong, what fatigue will there be to inherit! Moreover, our state's troops have been newly broken. The king cannot sit at ease. He has swept the entire realm and placed it exclusively under the general. The state's safety or danger rests on this one action. Now he does not pity the soldiers but follows his private interests. He is not a minister of the state altars.' Xiang Yu went to the morning audience with Supreme General Song Yi, and immediately in his tent beheaded Song Yi. He issued an order in the army saying: 'Song Yi conspired with Qi to rebel against Chu. The Chu king secretly ordered me to execute him.' At this time, all the generals trembled and submitted. None dared to oppose. They all said: 'The ones who first established Chu were the general's family. Now the general has executed the rebel.' They then mutually agreed to establish Yu as acting supreme general. They sent people to pursue Song Yi's son. They caught up with him in Qi and killed him. They sent Huan Chu to report the command to King Huai. King Huai therefore made Xiang Yu supreme general. Lord Dangyang and General Pu all came under Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 項羽已殺卿子冠軍，威震楚國，名聞諸侯。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu already killed Qing Zi Champion, awe shook Chu state, name heard feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu killed the Qin supreme commander Wang Li, captured his army of 200,000 men, and sank their armor and weapons in the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 乃遣當陽君、蒲將軍將卒二萬渡河，救鉅鹿。

translations.literal: Then sent Dangyang Jun, Pu general led troops twenty thousand cross river, rescue Ju Lu.
translations.idiomatic: He slaughtered the surrendered soldiers and buried their corpses.

sentences.zh: 戰少利，陳餘復請兵。

translations.literal: Battle little advantage, Chen Yu again requested troops.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked and took Xianyang.

sentences.zh: 項羽乃悉引兵渡河，皆沈船，破釜甑，燒廬舍，持三日糧，以示士卒必死，無一還心。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu then completely led troops cross river, all sank boats, broke cooking pots cauldrons, burned dwellings, held three days rations, to show soldiers must die, no one return heart.
translations.idiomatic: The Second Emperor surrendered to Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 於是至則圍王離，與秦軍遇，九戰，絕其甬道，大破之，殺蘇角，虜王離。

translations.literal: Therefore arrived then surrounded Wang Li, with Qin army encountered, nine battles, cut off their covered walkway, greatly defeated them, killed Su Jiao, captured Wang Li.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu burned the Qin palace and took the Second Emperor's seal.

sentences.zh: 涉閒不降楚，自燒殺。

translations.literal: She Jian not surrendered Chu, self burned killed.
translations.idiomatic: He established Zhao Gao as king of Qin.

sentences.zh: 當是時，楚兵冠諸侯。

translations.literal: At this time, Chu's troops were the strongest among the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu returned east.

sentences.zh: 諸侯軍救鉅鹿下者十餘壁，莫敢縱兵。

translations.literal: Feudal lords armies rescued Ju Lu camped ten more fortifications, none dared unleash troops.
translations.idiomatic: He stationed troops at Hongmen.

sentences.zh: 及楚擊秦，諸將皆從壁上觀。

translations.literal: When Chu struck Qin, various generals all from fortifications top observed.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Liu Bang had entered Guanzhong.

sentences.zh: 楚戰士無不一以當十，楚兵呼聲動天，諸侯軍無不人人惴恐。

translations.literal: Chu warriors none not one to match ten, Chu troops battle cries shook heaven, feudal lords armies none not person person fearful.
translations.idiomatic: He stationed at Bashang.

sentences.zh: 於是已破秦軍，項羽召見諸侯將，入轅門，無不膝行而前，莫敢仰視。

translations.literal: Therefore already defeated Qin army, Xiang Yu summoned saw feudal lords generals, entered camp gate, none not knee-walked forward, none dared look up.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu was angry that Liu Bang had taken Guanzhong.

sentences.zh: 項羽由是始為諸侯上將軍，諸侯皆屬焉。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu from this began as feudal lords supreme general, feudal lords all belonged to him.
translations.idiomatic: He wanted to attack Liu Bang.

translations.literal: Xiang Yu had already killed the Champion Marquis. His awe shook the Chu state. His name was heard among the feudal lords. He then sent Lord Dangyang and General Pu leading twenty thousand troops to cross the river and rescue Julu. They fought with little advantage. Chen Yu again requested troops. Xiang Yu then led all his troops across the river. He sank all the boats, broke the cooking pots and cauldrons, burned the dwellings, and gave each soldier only three days of rations. This showed the soldiers they must die—no one had thoughts of returning. Upon arrival, they surrounded Wang Li. They encountered the Qin army and fought nine battles. They cut off their covered supply walkway, greatly defeated them, killed Su Jiao, and captured Wang Li. She Jian did not surrender to Chu. He burned himself to death. At this time, Chu's troops were the strongest among the feudal lords. The feudal lords' armies that had come to rescue Julu were camped in more than ten fortifications. None dared to unleash their troops. When Chu struck Qin, all the generals observed from atop their fortifications. Chu's warriors were all one matching ten. Chu's troops' battle cries shook heaven. None of the feudal lords' armies were not fearful, every person terrified. Having defeated the Qin army, Xiang Yu summoned the feudal lords' generals. They entered the camp gate, all crawling forward on their knees. None dared to look up. From this point, Xiang Yu became the supreme general of the feudal lords. All the feudal lords came under him.

sentences.zh: 章邯軍棘原，項羽軍漳南，相持未戰。

translations.literal: Zhang Han army Ji Yuan, Xiang Yu army Zhang south, mutually held not fought.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Bo advised Xiang Yu: "If you kill Liu Bang, you will lose the people's hearts.

sentences.zh: 秦軍數卻，二世使人讓章邯。

translations.literal: Qin army several times retreated, Second Generation made people blame Zhang Han.
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to divide the land and enfeoff him."

sentences.zh: 章邯恐，使長史欣請事。

translations.literal: Zhang Han feared, made chief clerk Xin request matters.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu agreed.

sentences.zh: 至咸陽，留司馬門三日，趙高不見，有不信之心。

translations.literal: Arrived Xianyang, stayed Sima gate three days, Zhao Gao not saw, had distrust heart.
translations.idiomatic: He divided the empire among the generals.

sentences.zh: 長史欣恐，還走其軍，不敢出故道，趙高果使人追之，不及。

translations.literal: Chief clerk Xin feared, returned fled his army, not dared exit old road, Zhao Gao indeed made people pursue him, not reached.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed Liu Bang as King of Han, with Guanzhong as his territory.

sentences.zh: 欣至軍，報曰：「趙高用事於中，下無可為者。

translations.literal: Xin arrived army, reported said: 'Zhao Gao handles affairs in middle, below none can be done.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed himself as King of Western Chu, with Pengcheng as his capital.

sentences.zh: 今戰能勝，高必疾妒吾功；

translations.literal: Now battle can victory, Gao must quickly envy my merit;
translations.idiomatic: He sent the various kings to their territories.

sentences.zh: 戰不能勝，不免於死。

translations.literal: Battle cannot victory, not avoid death.
translations.idiomatic: The kings all departed to their lands.

sentences.zh: 願將軍孰計之。」

translations.literal: Wish general carefully consider it.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said to Liu Bang: "The world's troubles started because of us two.

sentences.zh: 陳餘亦遺章邯書曰：「白起為秦將，南征鄢郢，北阬馬服，攻城略地，不可勝計，而竟賜死。

translations.literal: Chen Yu also sent Zhang Han letter said: 'Bai Qi was Qin general, south conquered Yan Ying, north buried Ma Fu, attacked cities seized lands, cannot be counted, and finally granted death.
translations.idiomatic: Now I have heard that Han Xin is rebelling in Qi.

sentences.zh: 蒙恬為秦將，北逐戎人，開榆中地數千里，竟斬陽周。

translations.literal: Meng Tian was Qin general, north pursued Rong people, opened Yuzhong land several thousand li, finally beheaded Yang Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: I will attack Qi. You go west to guard your territory."

sentences.zh: 何者？

translations.literal: Why?
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang agreed and went west.

sentences.zh: 功多，秦不能盡封，因以法誅之。

translations.literal: Merits many, Qin cannot completely enfeoff, therefore with law execute them.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 今將軍為秦將三歲矣，所亡失以十萬數，而諸侯并起滋益多。

translations.literal: Now general was Qin general three years, what lost by hundred thousand count, and feudal lords together rise increasing more.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Guang defended against him at Chengyang.

sentences.zh: 彼趙高素諛日久，今事急，亦恐二世誅之，故欲以法誅將軍以塞責，使人更代將軍以脫其禍。

translations.literal: That Zhao Gao always flattered long time, now matters urgent, also fears Second Generation execute him, therefore wishes with law execute general to block responsibility, make people replace general to escape his calamity.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu attacked Chengyang but could not take it.

sentences.zh: 夫將軍居外久，多內卻，有功亦誅，無功亦誅。

translations.literal: Now general resides outside long, many inner retreats, have merit also execute, no merit also execute.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked and took Dingtao.

sentences.zh: 且天之亡秦，無愚智皆知之。

translations.literal: Moreover heaven's abandonment of Qin, no foolish wise all know it.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong of Qi attacked Peng Yue.

sentences.zh: 今將軍內不能直諫，外為亡國將，孤特獨立而欲常存，豈不哀哉！

translations.literal: Now general inside cannot straight remonstrate, outside is perished state general, isolated alone stands and wishes always survive, how not sorrowful!
translations.idiomatic: Peng Yue was defeated and fled.

sentences.zh: 將軍何不還兵與諸侯為從，約共攻秦，分王其地，南面稱孤；

translations.literal: General why not turn troops with feudal lords ally, agree together attack Qin, divide king its lands, face south call solitary;
translations.idiomatic: He joined Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 此孰與身伏鈇質，妻子為僇乎？」

translations.literal: This which compared to body prostrate axe block, wife children become slaughtered?'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong heard that Dingtao had fallen.

sentences.zh: 章邯狐疑，陰使候始成使項羽，欲約。

translations.literal: Zhang Han hesitated, secretly made scout Shi Cheng envoy Xiang Yu, wished agreement.
translations.idiomatic: He fled to Ju.

sentences.zh: 約未成，項羽使蒲將軍日夜引兵度三戶，軍漳南，與秦戰，再破之。

translations.literal: Agreement not completed, Xiang Yu made Pu general day night led troops crossed San Hu, army Zhang south, with Qin fought, again defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu pursued and attacked Ju.

sentences.zh: 項羽悉引兵擊秦軍汙水上，大破之。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu completely led troops struck Qin army Wu Shui on, greatly defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: He took Ju and killed Tian Rong.

translations.literal: Zhang Han's army was at Jiyuan. Xiang Yu's army was south of the Zhang River. They faced each other but did not fight. The Qin army retreated several times. The Second Generation Emperor sent people to blame Zhang Han. Zhang Han grew fearful. He sent his chief clerk Xin to negotiate surrender. He arrived at Xianyang and waited at the Sima Gate for three days. Zhao Gao did not see him. He had thoughts of distrust. Chief Clerk Xin grew fearful. He returned and fled to his army. He did not dare take the old road. Zhao Gao indeed sent people to pursue him, but they did not catch up. Xin arrived at the army and reported: 'Zhao Gao handles affairs in the court. There is nothing that can be done below. If we win battles now, Gao will quickly envy my merit; If we cannot win battles, we cannot avoid death. I hope the general will carefully consider this.' Chen Yu also sent Zhang Han a letter saying: 'Bai Qi was a Qin general. He conquered Yan and Ying in the south, buried Ma Fu's army in the north, attacked cities and seized lands beyond counting, yet was finally granted death. Meng Tian was a Qin general. He pursued the Rong people north, opened up several thousand li of Yuzhong land, yet was finally beheaded at Yangzhou. Why? Their merits were too many. Qin could not fully reward them, so they executed them by law. The general has been a Qin general for three years. His losses number in the hundreds of thousands. Meanwhile the feudal lords have risen together and grown even more numerous. That Zhao Gao has long been flattering. Now matters are urgent. He also fears the Second Generation will execute him. Therefore he wants to execute the general by law to shift responsibility, and send someone to replace the general to escape his own calamity. The general has been stationed outside for a long time. There have been many retreats within. Whether you have merit or not, you will be executed. Moreover, that Heaven has abandoned Qin—both foolish and wise all know this. Now the general cannot remonstrate directly within, and outside he is the general of a perished state. He stands isolated and alone yet wishes to survive forever. How sorrowful! Why doesn't the general turn his troops and ally with the feudal lords? Agree to attack Qin together, divide and rule its lands, face south and call himself sovereign; How does this compare to prostrating your body on the executioner's block, with your wife and children slaughtered?' Zhang Han hesitated. He secretly sent the scout Shi Cheng as envoy to Xiang Yu, wishing to make an agreement. The agreement was not yet completed. Xiang Yu had General Pu lead troops day and night across Sanhu. The army was south of the Zhang River. They fought with Qin and again defeated them. Xiang Yu led all his troops to strike the Qin army on the Wushui River and greatly defeated them.

sentences.zh: 章邯使人見項羽，欲約。

translations.literal: Zhang Han made people see Xiang Yu, wished agreement.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Peng Yue to attack Tian Du.

sentences.zh: 項羽召軍吏謀曰：「糧少，欲聽其約。」

translations.literal: Xiang Yu summoned army officials consulted said: 'Grain little, wish listen to their agreement.'
translations.idiomatic: Peng Yue took Tian Du.

sentences.zh: 軍吏皆曰：「善。」

translations.literal: The army officials all said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: He sent Tian Heng and Tian Guang to attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 項羽乃與期洹水南殷虛上。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu then with them made appointment Huan Shui south Yin Xu on.
translations.idiomatic: They took Qi and killed Tian Guang.

sentences.zh: 已盟，章邯見項羽而流涕，為言趙高。

translations.literal: Already allied, Zhang Han saw Xiang Yu and streamed tears, spoke of Zhao Gao.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Heng fled.

sentences.zh: 項羽乃立章邯為雍王，置楚軍中。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu then established Zhang Han as Yong Wang, placed in Chu army middle.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu returned east.

sentences.zh: 使長史欣為上將軍，將秦軍為前行。

translations.literal: Made chief clerk Xin supreme general, led Qin army as advance guard.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin attacked Zhao.

translations.literal: Zhang Han sent people to see Xiang Yu, wishing to make an agreement. Xiang Yu summoned his army officials and consulted, saying: 'Our grain is low. I wish to accept their agreement.' The army officials all said: 'Good.' Xiang Yu then made an appointment with them south of the Huan River at Yinxu. After they allied, Zhang Han saw Xiang Yu and wept, speaking of Zhao Gao. Xiang Yu then established Zhang Han as King of Yong, placing him within the Chu army. He made Chief Clerk Xin supreme general, having him lead the Qin army as the vanguard.

sentences.zh: 到新安。

translations.literal: Arrived Xin An.
translations.idiomatic: He took Zhao and killed Chen Yu.

sentences.zh: 諸侯吏卒異時故繇使屯戍過秦中，秦中吏卒遇之多無狀，及秦軍降諸侯，諸侯吏卒乘勝多奴虜使之，輕折辱秦吏卒。

translations.literal: Feudal lords officials soldiers different times corvee service garrison passed Qin middle, Qin middle officials soldiers treated them many without manners, and Qin army surrendered feudal lords, feudal lords officials soldiers riding victory many enslaved used them, lightly broke humiliated Qin officials soldiers.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Yan.

sentences.zh: 秦吏卒多竊言曰：「章將軍等詐吾屬降諸侯，今能入關破秦，大善；

translations.literal: Qin officials soldiers many secretly spoke said: 'Zhang general etc. deceived us to surrender feudal lords, now able enter passes break Qin, very good;
translations.idiomatic: He took Yan.

sentences.zh: 即不能，諸侯虜吾屬而東，秦必盡誅吾父母妻子。」

translations.literal: If not able, feudal lords capture us east, Qin must completely execute our parents wives children.'
translations.idiomatic: He made himself king of Qi.

sentences.zh: 諸侯微聞其計，以告項羽。

translations.literal: Feudal lords secretly heard their plot, told Xiang Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Peng Yue attacked Wei.

sentences.zh: 項羽乃召黥布、蒲將軍計曰：「秦吏卒尚眾，其心不服，至關中不聽，事必危，不如擊殺之，而獨與章邯、長史欣、都尉翳入秦。」

translations.literal: Xiang Yu then summoned Qing Bu, Pu general consulted said: 'Qin officials soldiers still numerous, their hearts not submit, to Guan Zhong not obey, matters must danger, better strike kill them, and alone with Zhang Han, chief clerk Xin, commandery captain Yi enter Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: He took Wei and made himself king of Wei.

sentences.zh: 於是楚軍夜擊阬秦卒二十餘萬人新安城南。

translations.literal: Therefore Chu army night struck buried Qin soldiers twenty more ten thousand people Xin An city south.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Chu army night struck buried Qin soldiers twenty more ten thousand people Xin An city south. (translated).

translations.literal: They arrived at Xin'an. The feudal lords' officials and soldiers, who at different times had been conscripted to garrison and pass through Qin territory, were treated very poorly by Qin's officials and soldiers. Now that the Qin army had surrendered to the feudal lords, the feudal lords' officials and soldiers, riding on victory, often enslaved and used them, lightly breaking and humiliating the Qin officials and soldiers. The Qin officials and soldiers often whispered among themselves: 'General Zhang and the others deceived us into surrendering to the feudal lords. If we can now enter the passes and break Qin, that would be very good; If we cannot, the feudal lords will capture us and go east. Qin will certainly execute all our parents, wives, and children.' The feudal lords secretly heard of their plot and told Xiang Yu. Xiang Yu then summoned Qing Bu and General Pu to consult, saying: 'The Qin officials and soldiers are still numerous. Their hearts do not submit. When we reach Guanzhong they will not obey. This will certainly be dangerous. It is better to strike and kill them, and go alone with Zhang Han, Chief Clerk Xin, and Commandery Captain Yi to enter Qin.' Therefore the Chu army struck at night and buried alive more than two hundred thousand Qin soldiers south of Xin'an city.

sentences.zh: 行略定秦地。

translations.literal: Marched raided pacified Qin lands.
translations.idiomatic: Marched raided pacified Qin lands. (translated).

sentences.zh: 函谷關有兵守關，不得入。

translations.literal: Hangu Pass had troops guarding pass, could not enter.
translations.idiomatic: Hangu Pass had troops guarding pass, could not enter. (translated).

sentences.zh: 又聞沛公已破咸陽，項羽大怒，使當陽君等擊關。

translations.literal: Again heard Pei Gong already broke Xianyang, Xiang Yu greatly angered, made Dangyang Jun etc. strike pass.
translations.idiomatic: Again heard Pei Gong already broke Xianyang, Xiang Yu greatly angered, made Dangyang Jun etc. strike pass. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項羽遂入，至于戲西。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu then entered, arrived at Xi west.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu then entered, arrived at Xi west. (translated).

sentences.zh: 沛公軍霸上，未得與項羽相見。

translations.literal: Pei Gong army Ba Shang, not yet able with Xiang Yu meet.
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong army Ba Shang, not yet able with Xiang Yu meet. (translated).

sentences.zh: 沛公左司馬曹無傷使人言於項羽曰：「沛公欲王關中，使子嬰為相，珍寶盡有之。」

translations.literal: Pei Gong left adjutant Cao Wu Shang made people speak to Xiang Yu said: 'Pei Gong wishes king Guan Zhong, make Zi Ying chancellor, precious treasures all possess them.'
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong left adjutant Cao Wu Shang made people speak to Xiang Yu said: 'Pei Gong wishes king Guan Zhong, make Zi Ying chancellor, precious treasures all possess them.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項羽大怒，曰：「旦日饗士卒，為擊破沛公軍！」

translations.literal: Xiang Yu greatly angered, said: 'Tomorrow feast soldiers, for strike break Pei Gong army!'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu greatly angered, said: 'Tomorrow feast soldiers, for strike break Pei Gong army!' (translated).

sentences.zh: 當是時，項羽兵四十萬，在新豐鴻門，沛公兵十萬，在霸上。

translations.literal: At this time, Xiang Yu troops four hundred thousand, at Xinfeng Hong Men, Pei Gong troops one hundred thousand, at Ba Shang.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Xiang Yu troops four hundred thousand, at Xinfeng Hong Men, Pei Gong troops one hundred thousand, at Ba Shang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 范增說項羽曰：「沛公居山東時，貪於財貨，好美姬。

translations.literal: Fan Zeng advised Xiang Yu said: 'Pei Gong resided Shandong time, greedy for wealth goods, fond beautiful women.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng advised Xiang Yu said: 'Pei Gong resided Shandong time, greedy for wealth goods, fond beautiful women. (translated).

sentences.zh: 今入關，財物無所取，婦女無所幸，此其志不在小。

translations.literal: Now entered passes, wealth goods nothing took, women nothing favored, this his ambition not in small.
translations.idiomatic: Now entered passes, wealth goods nothing took, women nothing favored, this his ambition not in small. (translated).

sentences.zh: 吾令人望其氣，皆為龍虎，成五采，此天子氣也。

translations.literal: I made people observe his vapors, all dragon tiger, formed five colors, this Son of Heaven vapors.
translations.idiomatic: I made people observe his vapors, all dragon tiger, formed five colors, this Son of Heaven vapors. (translated).

sentences.zh: 急擊勿失。」

translations.literal: Strike quickly. Do not lose this opportunity.'
translations.idiomatic: Strike quickly. Do not lose this opportunity.' (translated).

translations.literal: As they marched, they raided and pacified Qin territory. Hangu Pass had troops guarding it. They could not enter. They then heard that Liu Bang had already broken Xianyang. Xiang Yu was greatly angered. He had Lord Dangyang and others strike the pass. Xiang Yu then entered and arrived west of Xi. Liu Bang's army was at Bashang. He had not yet been able to meet with Xiang Yu. Liu Bang's left adjutant Cao Wushang sent people to speak to Xiang Yu, saying: 'Liu Bang wishes to rule Guanzhong as king, make Zi Ying his chancellor, and possess all the precious treasures.' Xiang Yu was greatly angered and said: 'Tomorrow I will feast the soldiers, then strike and break Liu Bang's army!' At this time, Xiang Yu had four hundred thousand troops at Hongmen in Xinfeng. Liu Bang had one hundred thousand troops at Bashang. Fan Zeng advised Xiang Yu, saying: 'When Liu Bang resided in Shandong, he was greedy for wealth and goods, fond of beautiful women. Now he has entered the passes but taken no wealth or goods, favored no women. His ambitions are not small. I had people observe his aura. It was all dragon and tiger, forming the five colors. This is the aura of a Son of Heaven. Strike quickly. Do not lose this opportunity.'

sentences.zh: 楚左尹項伯者，項羽季父也，素善留侯張良。

translations.literal: Chu left minister Xiang Bo, Xiang Yu youngest uncle, always good with Liu Hou Zhang Liang.
translations.idiomatic: Chu left minister Xiang Bo, Xiang Yu youngest uncle, always good with Liu Hou Zhang Liang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 張良是時從沛公，項伯乃夜馳之沛公軍，私見張良，具告以事，欲呼張良與俱去。

translations.literal: Zhang Liang at this time followed Pei Gong, Xiang Bo then night galloped to Pei Gong army, privately saw Zhang Liang, fully told the matters, wished call Zhang Liang with him go.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang at this time followed Pei Gong, Xiang Bo then night galloped to Pei Gong army, privately saw Zhang Liang, fully told the matters, wished call Zhang Liang with him go. (translated).

sentences.zh: 曰：「毋從俱死也。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Do not follow together die.'
translations.idiomatic: Said: 'Do not follow together die.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「臣為韓王送沛公，沛公今事有急，亡去不義，不可不語。」

translations.literal: Zhang Liang said: 'Minister for Han Wang sent Pei Gong, Pei Gong now matters urgent, flee not righteous, cannot not tell.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang said: 'Minister for Han Wang sent Pei Gong, Pei Gong now matters urgent, flee not righteous, cannot not tell.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 良乃入，具告沛公。

translations.literal: Liang then entered and fully told Liu Bang.
translations.idiomatic: Liang then entered and fully told Liu Bang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 沛公大驚，曰：「為之柰何？」

translations.literal: Pei Gong greatly startled, said: 'Do what?'
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong greatly startled, said: 'Do what?' (translated).

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「誰為大王為此計者？」

translations.literal: Zhang Liang said: 'Who for great king made this plan?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang said: 'Who for great king made this plan?' (translated).

sentences.zh: 曰：「鯫生說我曰『距關，毋內諸侯，秦地可盡王也』。

translations.literal: Said: 'Small man advised me said 'bar pass, do not admit feudal lords, Qin lands can all king.'
translations.idiomatic: Said: 'Small man advised me said 'bar pass, do not admit feudal lords, Qin lands can all king.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 故聽之。」

translations.literal: So I listened to him.'
translations.idiomatic: So I listened to him.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 良曰：「料大王士卒足以當項王乎？」

translations.literal: Liang said: 'Estimate great king soldiers sufficient to match Xiang Wang?'
translations.idiomatic: Liang said: 'Estimate great king soldiers sufficient to match Xiang Wang?' (translated).

sentences.zh: 沛公默然，曰：「固不如也，且為之柰何？」

translations.literal: Pei Gong silent, said: 'Certainly not equal, moreover do what?'
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong silent, said: 'Certainly not equal, moreover do what?' (translated).

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「請往謂項伯，言沛公不敢背項王也。」

translations.literal: Zhang Liang said: 'Please go tell Xiang Bo, speak Pei Gong not dare turn against Xiang Wang.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang said: 'Please go tell Xiang Bo, speak Pei Gong not dare turn against Xiang Wang.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 沛公曰：「君安與項伯有故？」

translations.literal: Pei Gong said: 'Sir how with Xiang Bo have old friendship?'
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong said: 'Sir how with Xiang Bo have old friendship?' (translated).

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「秦時與臣游，項伯殺人，臣活之。

translations.literal: Zhang Liang said: 'Qin time with minister wandered, Xiang Bo killed person, minister saved him.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang said: 'Qin time with minister wandered, Xiang Bo killed person, minister saved him. (translated).

sentences.zh: 今事有急，故幸來告良。」

translations.literal: Now matters are urgent, so fortunately he came to tell me.'
translations.idiomatic: Now matters are urgent, so fortunately he came to tell me.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 沛公曰「孰與君少長？」

translations.literal: Pei Gong said 'Who with sir young old?'
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong said 'Who with sir young old?' (translated).

sentences.zh: 良曰：「長於臣。」

translations.literal: Liang said: 'Older than me.'
translations.idiomatic: Liang said: 'Older than me.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 沛公曰「君為我呼入，吾得兄事之。」

translations.literal: Pei Gong said 'Sir for me call in, I get brother serve him.'
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong said 'Sir for me call in, I get brother serve him.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 張良出，要項伯。

translations.literal: Zhang Liang went out, intercepted Xiang Bo.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang went out, intercepted Xiang Bo. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項伯即入見沛公。

translations.literal: Xiang Bo immediately entered saw Pei Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Bo immediately entered saw Pei Gong. (translated).

sentences.zh: 沛公奉卮酒為壽，約為婚姻，曰：「吾入關，秋豪不敢有所近，籍吏民，封府庫，而待將軍。

translations.literal: Pei Gong offered goblet wine as toast, agreed marriage, said: 'I entered passes, down feather not dared approach anything, registered officials people, sealed treasuries, and waited general.
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong offered goblet wine as toast, agreed marriage, said: 'I entered passes, down feather not dared approach anything, registered officials people, sealed treasuries, and waited general. (translated).

sentences.zh: 所以遣將守關者，備他盜之出入與非常也。

translations.literal: Reason sent general guard pass, prepare other bandits enter exit and extraordinary.
translations.idiomatic: Reason sent general guard pass, prepare other bandits enter exit and extraordinary. (translated).

sentences.zh: 日夜望將軍至，豈敢反乎！

translations.literal: Day night hoped general arrive, how dared rebel!
translations.idiomatic: Day night hoped general arrive, how dared rebel! (translated).

sentences.zh: 願伯具言臣之不敢倍德也。」

translations.literal: Wish Bo fully speak minister not dare double virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: Wish Bo fully speak minister not dare double virtue.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項伯許諾。

translations.literal: Xiang Bo agreed.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Bo agreed. (translated).

sentences.zh: 謂沛公曰：「旦日不可不蚤自來謝項王。」

translations.literal: Said to Pei Gong: 'Tomorrow cannot not early come apologize Xiang Wang.'
translations.idiomatic: Said to Pei Gong: 'Tomorrow cannot not early come apologize Xiang Wang.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 沛公曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: Liu Bang said: 'Yes.'
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang said: 'Yes.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 於是項伯復夜去，至軍中，具以沛公言報項王。

translations.literal: Therefore Xiang Bo again night left, arrived army middle, fully with Pei Gong words reported Xiang Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Xiang Bo again night left, arrived army middle, fully with Pei Gong words reported Xiang Wang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 因言曰：「沛公不先破關中，公豈敢入乎？

translations.literal: Therefore spoke said: 'Pei Gong not first broke Guan Zhong, you how dared enter?
translations.idiomatic: Therefore spoke said: 'Pei Gong not first broke Guan Zhong, you how dared enter? (translated).

sentences.zh: 今人有大功而擊之，不義也，不如因善遇之。」

translations.literal: Now someone has great merit and strike him, not righteous, better take advantage good treat him.'
translations.idiomatic: Now someone has great merit and strike him, not righteous, better take advantage good treat him.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王許諾。

translations.literal: King Xiang agreed.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang agreed. (translated).

translations.literal: Xiang Bo, Chu's left minister, was Xiang Yu's youngest uncle. He had long been good friends with Marquis Liu Zhang Liang. Zhang Liang was at this time following Liu Bang. Xiang Bo then galloped at night to Liu Bang's army. He privately saw Zhang Liang and fully told him the matters, wishing to call Zhang Liang to go with him. He said: 'Do not follow him and die together.' Zhang Liang said: 'I escorted Liu Bang for the King of Han. Liu Bang's matters are now urgent. To flee would not be righteous. I cannot fail to tell him.' Liang then entered and fully told Liu Bang. Liu Bang was greatly startled and said: 'What should I do?' Zhang Liang said: 'Who devised this plan for the great king?'
