He said: 'A small man advised me, saying "Bar the pass, do not admit the feudal lords. You can rule all Qin lands." So I listened to him.' Liang said: 'Do you estimate that the great king's soldiers are sufficient to match King Xiang?' Liu Bang was silent, then said: 'Certainly not equal. Moreover, what should I do?' Zhang Liang said: 'Please go tell Xiang Bo that Liu Bang dares not turn against King Xiang.' Liu Bang said: 'Sir, how do you have an old friendship with Xiang Bo?' Zhang Liang said: 'During Qin times, Xiang Bo wandered with me. Xiang Bo killed a man, and I saved him. Now matters are urgent, so fortunately he came to tell me.' Liu Bang said: 'Who is younger or older than you?' Liang said: 'Older than me.' Liu Bang said: 'Sir, call him in for me. I will treat him as an elder brother.' Zhang Liang went out and intercepted Xiang Bo. Xiang Bo immediately entered and saw Liu Bang. Liu Bang offered a goblet of wine as a toast and agreed to marriage, saying: 'When I entered the passes, I dared not approach even the smallest thing. I registered the officials and people, sealed the treasuries, and waited for the general. The reason I sent a general to guard the pass was to prepare for other bandits entering and exiting, and for extraordinary circumstances. Day and night I hoped for the general to arrive. How would I dare rebel! I hope you will fully explain that I, your minister, do not dare to betray virtue.' Xiang Bo agreed. He said to Liu Bang: 'Tomorrow you must come early to apologize to King Xiang.' Liu Bang said: 'Yes.' Therefore Xiang Bo again left at night and arrived in the army camp. He fully reported Liu Bang's words to King Xiang. He then said: 'If Liu Bang had not first broken Guanzhong, how would you have dared to enter? Now someone has achieved great merit, yet you would strike him. That is not righteous. It is better to take advantage of this and treat him well.' King Xiang agreed.

sentences.zh: 沛公旦日從百餘騎來見項王，至鴻門，謝曰：「臣與將軍戮力而攻秦，將軍戰河北，臣戰河南，然不自意能先入關破秦，得復見將軍於此。

translations.literal: Pei Gong next day from hundred more riders came see Xiang Wang, arrived Hong Men, apologized said: 'Minister with general united strength attacked Qin, general fought Hebei, minister fought Henan, yet not self expected able first enter passes break Qin, got again see general at this.
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong next day from hundred more riders came see Xiang Wang, arrived Hong Men, apologized said: 'Minister with general united strength attacked Qin, general fought Hebei, minister fought Henan, yet not self expected able first enter passes break Qin, got again see general at this. (translated).

sentences.zh: 今者有小人之言，令將軍與臣有郤。」

translations.literal: Now there are petty men words, make general with minister have rift.'
translations.idiomatic: Now there are petty men words, make general with minister have rift.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「此沛公左司馬曹無傷言之；

translations.literal: Xiang Wang said: 'This Pei Gong left adjutant Cao Wu Shang spoke;
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang said: 'This Pei Gong left adjutant Cao Wu Shang spoke; (translated).

sentences.zh: 不然，籍何以至此。」

translations.literal: If not, Ji why to this.'
translations.idiomatic: If not, Ji why to this.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王即日因留沛公與飲。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang that day therefore kept Pei Gong with drink.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang that day therefore kept Pei Gong with drink. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王、項伯東向坐。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang, Xiang Bo east facing sat.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang, Xiang Bo east facing sat. (translated).

sentences.zh: 亞父南向坐。

translations.literal: Ya Fu south facing sat.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord Father sat facing south.

sentences.zh: 亞父者，范增也。

translations.literal: Ya Fu, Fan Zeng.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord Father was Fan Zeng.

sentences.zh: 沛公北向坐，張良西向侍。

translations.literal: Pei Gong north facing sat, Zhang Liang west facing served.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng numbered Xiang Yu's faults one by one.

sentences.zh: 范增數目項王，舉所佩玉珪以示之者三，項王默然不應。

translations.literal: Fan Zeng frequently eyed Xiang Wang, raised what he wore jade tablet to show him three times, Xiang Wang silently not responded.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu did not listen.

sentences.zh: 范增起，出召項莊，謂曰：「君王為人不忍，若入前為壽，壽畢，請以劍舞，因擊沛公於坐，殺之。

translations.literal: Fan Zeng rose, went out summoned Xiang Zhuang, said: 'Lord king as person not cruel, if enter front make toast, toast finished, please with sword dance, take advantage strike Pei Gong at seat, kill him.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng said: "If you do not listen to my words, your clan will surely be extinguished."

sentences.zh: 不者，若屬皆且為所虜。」

translations.literal: If not, your kind all moreover be captured by him.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu remained silent.

sentences.zh: 莊則入為壽，壽畢，曰：「君王與沛公飲，軍中無以為樂，請以劍舞。」

translations.literal: Zhuang then entered made toast, toast finished, said: 'Lord king with Pei Gong drink, army middle nothing to make merry, please with sword dance.'
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang entered Hongmen.

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「諾。」

translations.literal: King Xiang said: 'Yes.'
translations.idiomatic: He said to Xiang Yu: "You and I both labored to destroy Qin.

sentences.zh: 項莊拔劍起舞，項伯亦拔劍起舞，常以身翼蔽沛公，莊不得擊。

translations.literal: Xiang Zhuang drew sword rose danced, Xiang Bo also drew sword rose danced, constantly with body flank shielded Pei Gong, Zhuang could not strike.
translations.idiomatic: I stayed in Guanzhong to guard it.

sentences.zh: 於是張良至軍門，見樊噲。

translations.literal: Therefore Zhang Liang arrived army gate, saw Fan Kuai.
translations.idiomatic: You returned east to settle affairs.

sentences.zh: 樊噲曰：「今日之事何如？」

translations.literal: Fan Kuai said: 'Today matters what like?'
translations.idiomatic: Now there are slanders saying I want to rebel.

sentences.zh: 良曰：「甚急。

translations.literal: Liang said: 'Very urgent.
translations.idiomatic: That is not true. I have come today to clear up these rumors."

sentences.zh: 今者項莊拔劍舞，其意常在沛公也。」

translations.literal: Now Xiang Zhuang draws sword dances, his intent constantly at Pei Gong.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said: "It was your subordinate Xiao He who told me."

sentences.zh: 噲曰：「此迫矣，臣請入，與之同命。」

translations.literal: Kuai said: 'This urgent, minister please enter, with him same fate.'
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang said: "Even if Xiao He told you, it was because of Cao Wushang.

sentences.zh: 噲即帶劍擁盾入軍門。

translations.literal: Kuai immediately strapped sword embraced shield entered army gate.
translations.idiomatic: Cao Wushang betrayed me and told you lies."

sentences.zh: 交戟之衛士欲止不內，樊噲側其盾以撞，衛士仆地，噲遂入，披帷西向立，瞋目視項王，頭髪上指，目眥盡裂。

translations.literal: Crossed halberds guards wished stop not admit, Fan Kuai tilted his shield to collide, guards fell ground, Kuai then entered, parted curtain west facing stood, glared eyes viewed Xiang Wang, hair on head pointed up, eye corners completely split.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu believed Liu Bang.

sentences.zh: 項王按劍而跽曰：「客何為者？」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang pressed sword and knelt said: 'Guest what doing?'
translations.idiomatic: He set up a banquet at Hongmen.

sentences.zh: 張良曰：「沛公之參乘樊噲者也。」

translations.literal: Zhang Liang said: 'Pei Gong chariot rider Fan Kuai.'
translations.idiomatic: He invited Liu Bang to drink.

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「壯士，賜之卮酒。」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang said: 'Brave warrior, grant him goblet wine.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu and Fan Zeng plotted to kill Liu Bang.

sentences.zh: 則與斗卮酒。

translations.literal: Then gave him peck goblet wine.
translations.idiomatic: They said: "Liu Bang wants to take Guanzhong.

sentences.zh: 噲拜謝，起，立而飲之。

translations.literal: Kuai bowed thanked, rose, stood and drank it.
translations.idiomatic: His ambitions are great. If we don't kill him now, we will regret it later."

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「賜之彘肩。」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang said: 'Grant him pig shoulder.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu agreed.

sentences.zh: 則與一生彘肩。

translations.literal: Then gave him one whole pig shoulder.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered Xiang Zhuang to dance with sword.

sentences.zh: 樊噲覆其盾於地，加彘肩上，拔劍切而啗之。

translations.literal: Fan Kuai overturned his shield on ground, added pig shoulder on it, drew sword cut and ate it.
translations.idiomatic: He intended for Xiang Zhuang to attack Liu Bang during the dance.

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「壯士，能復飲乎？」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang said: 'Brave warrior, able again drink?'
translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng repeatedly gave signals to Xiang Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 樊噲曰：「臣死且不避，卮酒安足辭！

translations.literal: Fan Kuai said: 'Minister death moreover not avoid, goblet wine how worth refuse!
translations.idiomatic: But Xiang Zhuang did not understand.

sentences.zh: 夫秦王有虎狼之心，殺人如不能舉，刑人如恐不勝，天下皆叛之。

translations.literal: Now Qin king has tiger wolf heart, kill people as cannot lift, punish people as fear not enough, world all rebel him.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng rose and left the banquet.

sentences.zh: 懷王與諸將約曰『先破秦入咸陽者王之』。

translations.literal: Huai Wang with various generals agreed said 'First break Qin enter Xianyang, king him.'
translations.idiomatic: He called Xiang Zhuang out.

sentences.zh: 今沛公先破秦入咸陽，豪毛不敢有所近，封閉宮室，還軍霸上，以待大王來。

translations.literal: Now Pei Gong first broke Qin entered Xianyang, down feather not dared approach anything, sealed closed palaces, returned army Bashang, to wait great king come.
translations.idiomatic: He said: "The king has not given the order.

sentences.zh: 故遣將守關者，備他盜出入與非常也。

translations.literal: Therefore sent general guard pass, prepare other bandits enter exit and extraordinary.
translations.idiomatic: What are you doing?"

sentences.zh: 勞苦而功高如此，未有封侯之賞，而聽細說，欲誅有功之人。

translations.literal: Toiled labored and merit high like this, not yet had enfeoffed marquis reward, yet listen to petty words, wish execute meritorious people.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zhuang said: "I am dancing with sword."

sentences.zh: 此亡秦之續耳，竊為大王不取也。」

translations.literal: This perished Qin continuation, secretly for great king not take.'
translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng said: "This is not dancing with sword."

sentences.zh: 項王未有以應，曰：「坐。」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang not yet had to respond, said: 'Sit.'
translations.idiomatic: He struck the pillar with his sword.

sentences.zh: 樊噲從良坐。

translations.literal: Fan Kuai followed Liang sat.
translations.idiomatic: He said: "If you don't kill Liu Bang now, you will all become his prisoners."

sentences.zh: 坐須臾，沛公起如廁，因招樊噲出。

translations.literal: Sat brief moment, Pei Gong rose went toilet, took advantage beckoned Fan Kuai out.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Zhuang returned to the banquet.

translations.literal: The next day Liu Bang came to see King Xiang with more than a hundred riders. He arrived at Hongmen and apologized, saying: 'Your minister united with the general to attack Qin. The general fought north of the river, your minister fought south of the river. Yet I did not expect to be able to enter the passes first and break Qin, and thus meet the general again here. Now there are the words of petty men, causing a rift between the general and your minister.' King Xiang said: 'This was spoken by Liu Bang's left adjutant Cao Wushang; Otherwise, why would I, Ji, have come to this point.' King Xiang therefore kept Liu Bang that day and drank with him. King Xiang and Xiang Bo sat facing east. Yafu sat facing south. Yafu was Fan Zeng. Liu Bang sat facing north. Zhang Liang served facing west. Fan Zeng frequently glanced at King Xiang. He raised his jade tablet three times to signal him. King Xiang remained silent and did not respond. Fan Zeng rose and went out to summon Xiang Zhuang. He said: 'Our lord king is not a cruel person. If you enter and make a toast first, and when the toast is finished, request to dance with swords, then take advantage to strike Liu Bang at his seat and kill him. If not, you and all your kind will moreover be captured by him.' Zhuang then entered and made a toast. When the toast was finished, he said: 'The lord king is drinking with Liu Bang. The army has nothing for merriment. Please allow me to dance with swords.' King Xiang said: 'Yes.' Xiang Zhuang drew his sword and began to dance. Xiang Bo also drew his sword and danced. He constantly used his body to flank and shield Liu Bang. Zhuang could not strike. Therefore Zhang Liang went to the army gate and saw Fan Kuai. Fan Kuai said: 'How are matters today?' Liang said: 'Very urgent. Now Xiang Zhuang draws his sword and dances. His intent is constantly on Liu Bang.' Kuai said: 'This is critical. Your minister requests to enter and share the same fate with him.' Kuai immediately strapped on his sword, embraced his shield, and entered the army gate. The guards with crossed halberds wished to stop him and not admit him. Fan Kuai tilted his shield to collide with them. The guards fell to the ground. Kuai then entered, parted the curtain, stood facing west, glared at King Xiang with his eyes. His hair stood on end, his eyes were completely bloodshot. King Xiang pressed his sword and knelt, saying: 'What is this guest doing?' Zhang Liang said: 'He is Liu Bang's chariot driver, Fan Kuai.' King Xiang said: 'Brave warrior. Grant him a goblet of wine.' They then gave him a large goblet of wine. Kuai bowed in thanks, rose, stood and drank it. King Xiang said: 'Grant him a pork shoulder.' They then gave him a whole pork shoulder. Fan Kuai overturned his shield on the ground, placed the pork shoulder on it, drew his sword, cut it, and ate it. King Xiang said: 'Brave warrior, can you drink more?' Fan Kuai said: 'Your minister would not avoid even death. How could I refuse a goblet of wine! The Qin king has the heart of a tiger or wolf. He kills people as if unable to lift them all, punishes people as if fearing not enough. The world has all rebelled against him. King Huai agreed with the generals that 'Whoever first breaks Qin and enters Xianyang will rule it.' Now Liu Bang first broke Qin and entered Xianyang. He dared not approach even the smallest thing. He sealed the palaces, returned his army to Bashang, and waited for the great king to come. Therefore he sent a general to guard the pass, to prepare for other bandits entering and exiting, and for extraordinary circumstances. To have toiled and achieved such high merit, yet not received the reward of enfeoffment as marquis, and instead listen to petty slander, desiring to execute meritorious people. This is just continuing the ways of perished Qin. I secretly advise the great king not to do this.' King Xiang had nothing to respond with and said: 'Sit.' Fan Kuai sat next to Liang. After sitting a brief moment, Liu Bang rose as if going to the toilet, and took advantage to beckon Fan Kuai out.

sentences.zh: 沛公已出，項王使都尉陳平召沛公。

translations.literal: Pei Gong already left, Xiang Wang made commandery captain Chen Ping summon Pei Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He danced with sword again.

sentences.zh: 沛公曰：「今者出，未辭也，為之柰何？」

translations.literal: Pei Gong said: 'Now left, not took leave, do what?'
translations.idiomatic: He approached Liu Bang.

sentences.zh: 樊噲曰：「大行不顧細謹，大禮不辭小讓。

translations.literal: Fan Kuai said: 'Great undertakings not consider petty cautions, great rites not refuse small concessions.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang was terrified.

sentences.zh: 如今人方為刀俎，我為魚肉，何辭為。」

translations.literal: Now people just are knife chopping block, we are fish meat, what ceremony for.'
translations.idiomatic: He wanted to flee.

sentences.zh: 於是遂去。

translations.literal: Therefore he left.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang said to Xiang Yu: "The king is drunk."

sentences.zh: 乃令張良留謝。

translations.literal: Then ordered Zhang Liang stay apologize.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered Zhang Liang to leave.

sentences.zh: 良問曰：「大王來何操？」

translations.literal: Liang asked said: 'Great king come what hold?'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang left.

sentences.zh: 曰：「我持白璧一雙，欲獻項王，玉斗一雙，欲與亞父，會其怒，不敢獻。

translations.literal: Said: 'I hold white jade disc one pair, wished offer Xiang Wang, jade goblet one pair, wished give Ya Fu, encountered his anger, not dared offer.
translations.idiomatic: He told Liu Bang: "Leave now."

sentences.zh: 公為我獻之」張良曰：「謹諾。」

translations.literal: You for me offer them' Zhang Liang said: 'Respectfully yes.'
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang said: "I cannot leave without saying goodbye."

sentences.zh: 當是時，項王軍在鴻門下，沛公軍在霸上，相去四十里。

translations.literal: At this time, Xiang Wang army at Hongmen below, Pei Gong army at Bashang, separated forty li.
translations.idiomatic: He went to the toilet.

sentences.zh: 沛公則置車騎，脫身獨騎，與樊噲、夏侯嬰、靳彊、紀信等四人持劍盾步走，從酈山下，道芷陽閒行。

translations.literal: Pei Gong then abandoned chariot cavalry, escaped body alone rode, with Fan Kuai, Xiahou Ying, Jin Qiang, Ji Xin etc. four people held swords shields walked, from Li mountain below, road Zhiyang between went.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang's guard said: "We should leave."

sentences.zh: 沛公謂張良曰：「從此道至吾軍，不過二十里耳。

translations.literal: Pei Gong said to Zhang Liang: 'From this road to my army, not over twenty li.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang said: "The host has not dismissed us."

sentences.zh: 度我至軍中，公乃入。」

translations.literal: Estimate I arrive army middle, you then enter.'
translations.idiomatic: He returned to the banquet.

sentences.zh: 沛公已去，閒至軍中，張良入謝，曰：「沛公不勝桮杓，不能辭。

translations.literal: Pei Gong already left, after arrived army middle, Zhang Liang entered apologized, said: 'Pei Gong not able ladle, cannot take leave.
translations.idiomatic: He toasted Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 謹使臣良奉白璧一雙，再拜獻大王足下；

translations.literal: Respectfully made minister Liang present white jade disc one pair, twice bowed offered great king feet below;
translations.idiomatic: He said: "I cannot drink much."

sentences.zh: 玉斗一雙，再拜奉大將軍足下。」

translations.literal: Jade goblet one pair, twice bowed presented great general feet below.'
translations.idiomatic: Jade goblet one pair, twice bowed presented great general feet below.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「沛公安在？」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang said: 'Pei Gong where?'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang said: 'Pei Gong where?' (translated).

sentences.zh: 良曰：「聞大王有意督過之，脫身獨去，已至軍矣。」

translations.literal: Liang said: 'Heard great king had intention blame him, escaped body alone left, already arrived army.'
translations.idiomatic: Liang said: 'Heard great king had intention blame him, escaped body alone left, already arrived army.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王則受璧，置之坐上。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang then received jade disc, placed it seat on.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang then received jade disc, placed it seat on. (translated).

sentences.zh: 亞父受玉斗，置之地，拔劍撞而破之，曰：「唉！

translations.literal: Ya Fu received jade goblet, placed it ground, drew sword struck and broke it, said: 'Alas!
translations.idiomatic: Ya Fu received jade goblet, placed it ground, drew sword struck and broke it, said: 'Alas! (translated).

sentences.zh: 豎子不足與謀。

translations.literal: Youngster not sufficient with plan.
translations.idiomatic: Youngster not sufficient with plan. (translated).

sentences.zh: 奪項王天下者，必沛公也，吾屬今為之虜矣。」

translations.literal: Seize Xiang Wang world, must Pei Gong, we now for him captives.'
translations.idiomatic: Seize Xiang Wang world, must Pei Gong, we now for him captives.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 沛公至軍，立誅殺曹無傷。

translations.literal: Pei Gong arrived army, immediately executed Cao Wu Shang.
translations.idiomatic: Pei Gong arrived army, immediately executed Cao Wu Shang. (translated).

translations.literal: Liu Bang had already left. King Xiang sent Commandery Captain Chen Ping to summon Liu Bang back. Liu Bang said: 'I left just now without taking leave. What should I do?' Fan Kuai said: 'Great undertakings do not consider petty cautions. Great rites do not refuse small concessions. Now people are just the knife and chopping block, we are the fish and meat. What ceremony is there for?' Therefore he left. He then ordered Zhang Liang to stay and apologize. Liang asked: 'What did the great king bring?' He said: 'I brought a pair of white jade discs, intending to offer them to King Xiang, and a pair of jade goblets, intending to give them to Yafu. But encountering his anger, I did not dare offer them. You offer them for me.' Zhang Liang said: 'Respectfully, yes.' At this time, King Xiang's army was below Hongmen. Liu Bang's army was at Bashang. They were forty li apart. Liu Bang then abandoned his chariot and cavalry. He escaped alone on horseback with Fan Kuai, Xiahou Ying, Jin Qiang, and Ji Xin—these four men carrying swords and shields—walking on foot. They went from below Mount Li, taking the road through Zhiyang. Liu Bang said to Zhang Liang: 'From this road to my army, it's not over twenty li. Estimate when I arrive in the army camp, then you enter.' Liu Bang had already left. After a while he arrived in the army camp. Zhang Liang entered and apologized, saying: 'Liu Bang was overcome by the wine and could not take leave. Respectfully, your minister Liang presents a pair of white jade discs. I twice bow and offer them to the great king's feet; A pair of jade goblets. I twice bow and present them to the great general's feet.' King Xiang said: 'Where is Liu Bang?' Liang said: 'He heard the great king intended to blame him. He escaped alone and left. He has already arrived at his army.' King Xiang then received the jade disc and placed it on his seat. Yafu received the jade goblet, placed it on the ground, drew his sword, struck it, and broke it, saying: 'Alas! This youngster is not worth planning with. The one who will seize King Xiang's world will certainly be Liu Bang. We will now become his captives.' Liu Bang arrived at his army and immediately executed Cao Wushang.

sentences.zh: 居數日，項羽引兵西屠咸陽，殺秦降王子嬰，燒秦宮室，火三月不滅；

translations.literal: Resided several days, Xiang Yu led troops west slaughtered Xianyang, killed Qin surrendered prince Zi Ying, burned Qin palaces, fire three months not extinguished;
translations.idiomatic: Resided several days, Xiang Yu led troops west slaughtered Xianyang, killed Qin surrendered prince Zi Ying, burned Qin palaces, fire three months not extinguished; (translated).

sentences.zh: 收其貨寶婦女而東。

translations.literal: Collected their goods treasures women and east.
translations.idiomatic: Collected their goods treasures women and east. (translated).

sentences.zh: 人或說項王曰：「關中阻山河四塞，地肥饒，可都以霸。」

translations.literal: Someone advised Xiang Wang said: 'Guan Zhong blocked mountains rivers four barriers, land fertile rich, can capital to dominate.'
translations.idiomatic: Someone advised Xiang Wang said: 'Guan Zhong blocked mountains rivers four barriers, land fertile rich, can capital to dominate.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王見秦宮皆以燒殘破，又心懷思欲東歸，曰：「富貴不歸故鄉，如衣繡夜行，誰知之者！」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang saw Qin palaces all burned ruined broken, moreover heart longed wished east return, said: 'Wealth nobility not return hometown, like wear embroidered clothes night walk, who knows it!'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang saw Qin palaces all burned ruined broken, moreover heart longed wished east return, said: 'Wealth nobility not return hometown, like wear embroidered clothes night walk, who knows it!' (translated).

sentences.zh: 說者曰：「人言楚人沐猴而冠耳，果然。」

translations.literal: Adviser said: 'People say Chu people bathing monkey wears hat, indeed.'
translations.idiomatic: Adviser said: 'People say Chu people bathing monkey wears hat, indeed.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王聞之，烹說者。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang heard it, boiled adviser.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang heard it, boiled adviser. (translated).

translations.literal: After several days, Xiang Yu led his troops west and slaughtered Xianyang. He killed the Qin surrendered prince Zi Ying, burned the Qin palaces. The fire did not extinguish for three months; He collected their goods, treasures, and women and went east. Someone advised King Xiang, saying: 'Guanzhong is blocked by mountains and rivers on four sides. The land is fertile and rich. You can make it your capital and dominate.' King Xiang saw that all the Qin palaces were burned and ruined. Moreover, his heart longed to return east. He said: 'Wealth and nobility without returning to your hometown is like wearing embroidered clothes while walking at night—who would know!' The adviser said: 'People say Chu people are bathing monkeys wearing hats. Indeed.' King Xiang heard it and boiled the adviser.

sentences.zh: 項王使人致命懷王。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang sent people report command Huai Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang sent people report command Huai Wang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 懷王曰：「如約。」

translations.literal: King Huai said: 'As agreed.'
translations.idiomatic: King Huai said: 'As agreed.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 乃尊懷王為義帝。

translations.literal: Then honored Huai Wang as Righteous Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Then honored Huai Wang as Righteous Emperor. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王欲自王，先王諸將相。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang wished self king, first king various generals ministers.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang wished self king, first king various generals ministers. (translated).

sentences.zh: 謂曰：「天下初發難時，假立諸侯後以伐秦。

translations.literal: Said: 'World initially began difficulties time, temporarily established feudal lords descendants to attack Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Said: 'World initially began difficulties time, temporarily established feudal lords descendants to attack Qin. (translated).

sentences.zh: 然身被堅執銳首事，暴露於野三年，滅秦定天下者，皆將相諸君與籍之力也。

translations.literal: Yet personally wore armor wielded sharp first began matters, exposed in wilds three years, extinguished Qin settled world, all generals ministers various lords with Ji strength.
translations.idiomatic: Yet personally wore armor wielded sharp first began matters, exposed in wilds three years, extinguished Qin settled world, all generals ministers various lords with Ji strength. (translated).

sentences.zh: 義帝雖無功，故當分其地而王之。」

translations.literal: Righteous Emperor though no merit, therefore should divide his lands and king him.'
translations.idiomatic: Righteous Emperor though no merit, therefore should divide his lands and king him.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 諸將皆曰：「善。」

translations.literal: All the generals said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: All the generals said: 'Good.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 乃分天下，立諸將為侯王。

translations.literal: Then divided world, established various generals as marquises kings.
translations.idiomatic: Then divided world, established various generals as marquises kings. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王、范增疑沛公之有天下，業已講解，又惡負約，恐諸侯叛之，乃陰謀曰：「巴、蜀道險，秦之遷人皆居蜀。」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang, Fan Zeng suspected Pei Gong would have world, already reconciled, moreover hated break agreement, feared feudal lords rebel him, then secretly planned said: 'Ba, Shu roads dangerous, Qin banished people all resided Shu.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang, Fan Zeng suspected Pei Gong would have world, already reconciled, moreover hated break agreement, feared feudal lords rebel him, then secretly planned said: 'Ba, Shu roads dangerous, Qin banished people all resided Shu.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 乃曰：「巴、蜀亦關中地也。」

translations.literal: Then said: 'Ba, Shu also Guan Zhong land.'
translations.idiomatic: Then said: 'Ba, Shu also Guan Zhong land.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 故立沛公為漢王，王巴、蜀、漢中，都南鄭。

translations.literal: Therefore established Pei Gong as Han Wang, ruled Ba, Shu, Hanzhong, capital Nanzheng.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore established Pei Gong as Han Wang, ruled Ba, Shu, Hanzhong, capital Nanzheng. (translated).

sentences.zh: 而三分關中，王秦降將以距塞漢王。

translations.literal: And divided Guan Zhong into three, kinged Qin surrendered generals to block bar Han Wang.
translations.idiomatic: And divided Guan Zhong into three, kinged Qin surrendered generals to block bar Han Wang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王乃立章邯為雍王，王咸陽以西，都廢丘。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang then established Zhang Han as Yong Wang, ruled Xianyang west, capital Fei Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang then established Zhang Han as Yong Wang, ruled Xianyang west, capital Fei Qiu. (translated).

sentences.zh: 長史欣者，故為櫟陽獄掾，嘗有德於項梁；

translations.literal: Chief clerk Xin, formerly was Que Yang prison clerk, once had virtue to Xiang Liang;
translations.idiomatic: Chief clerk Xin, formerly was Que Yang prison clerk, once had virtue to Xiang Liang; (translated).

sentences.zh: 都尉董翳者，本勸章邯降楚。

translations.literal: Commandery captain Dong Yi, originally advised Zhang Han surrender Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Commandery captain Dong Yi, originally advised Zhang Han surrender Chu. (translated).

sentences.zh: 故立司馬欣為塞王，王咸陽以東至河，都櫟陽；

translations.literal: Therefore established Sima Xin as Sai Wang, ruled Xianyang east to river, capital Que Yang;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore established Sima Xin as Sai Wang, ruled Xianyang east to river, capital Que Yang; (translated).

sentences.zh: 立董翳為翟王，王上郡，都高奴。

translations.literal: Established Dong Yi as Di Wang, ruled Shang Commandery, capital Gao Nu.
translations.idiomatic: Established Dong Yi as Di Wang, ruled Shang Commandery, capital Gao Nu. (translated).

sentences.zh: 徙魏王豹為西魏王，王河東，都平陽。

translations.literal: Moved Wei Wang Bao to West Wei Wang, ruled Hedong, capital Pingyang.
translations.idiomatic: Moved Wei Wang Bao to West Wei Wang, ruled Hedong, capital Pingyang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 瑕丘申陽者，張耳嬖臣也，先下河南（郡），迎楚河上，故立申陽為河南王，都雒陽。

translations.literal: Xia Qiu Shen Yang, Zhang Er favorite minister, first submitted Henan commandery, welcomed Chu on river, therefore established Shen Yang as Henan Wang, capital Luoyang.
translations.idiomatic: Xia Qiu Shen Yang, Zhang Er favorite minister, first submitted Henan commandery, welcomed Chu on river, therefore established Shen Yang as Henan Wang, capital Luoyang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 韓王成因故都，都陽翟。

translations.literal: Han Wang Cheng according to old capital, capital Yang Di.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang Cheng according to old capital, capital Yang Di. (translated).

sentences.zh: 趙將司馬卬定河內，數有功，故立卬為殷王，王河內，都朝歌。

translations.literal: Zhao general Sima Ang pacified Henan, several times had merit, therefore established Ang as Yin Wang, ruled Henan, capital Zhaoge.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao general Sima Ang pacified Henan, several times had merit, therefore established Ang as Yin Wang, ruled Henan, capital Zhaoge. (translated).

sentences.zh: 徙趙王歇為代王。

translations.literal: Moved Zhao Wang Xie to Dai Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Moved Zhao Wang Xie to Dai Wang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 趙相張耳素賢，又從入關，故立耳為常山王，王趙地，都襄國。

translations.literal: Zhao chancellor Zhang Er originally worthy, moreover followed enter passes, therefore established Er as Changshan Wang, ruled Zhao lands, capital Xiangguo.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao chancellor Zhang Er originally worthy, moreover followed enter passes, therefore established Er as Changshan Wang, ruled Zhao lands, capital Xiangguo. (translated).

sentences.zh: 當陽君黥布為楚將，常冠軍，故立布為九江王，都六。

translations.literal: Dangyang Jun Qing Bu was Chu general, constantly champion, therefore established Bu as Jiujiang Wang, capital Liu.
translations.idiomatic: Dangyang Jun Qing Bu was Chu general, constantly champion, therefore established Bu as Jiujiang Wang, capital Liu. (translated).

sentences.zh: 鄱君吳芮率百越佐諸侯，又從入關，故立芮為衡山王，都邾。

translations.literal: Po Jun Wu Rui led hundred Yue assisted feudal lords, moreover followed enter passes, therefore established Rui as Hengshan Wang, capital Zhu.
translations.idiomatic: Po Jun Wu Rui led hundred Yue assisted feudal lords, moreover followed enter passes, therefore established Rui as Hengshan Wang, capital Zhu. (translated).

sentences.zh: 義帝柱國共敖將兵擊南郡，功多，因立敖為臨江王，都江陵。

translations.literal: Righteous Emperor supreme pillar state Gong Ao led troops struck Nan commandery, merit many, therefore established Ao as Linjiang Wang, capital Jiangling.
translations.idiomatic: Righteous Emperor supreme pillar state Gong Ao led troops struck Nan commandery, merit many, therefore established Ao as Linjiang Wang, capital Jiangling. (translated).

sentences.zh: 徙燕王韓廣為遼東王。

translations.literal: Moved Yan Wang Han Guang to Liaodong Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Moved Yan Wang Han Guang to Liaodong Wang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 燕將臧荼從楚救趙，因從入關，故立荼為燕王，都薊。

translations.literal: Yan general Zang Tu followed Chu rescued Zhao, moreover followed enter passes, therefore established Tu as Yan Wang, capital Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Yan general Zang Tu followed Chu rescued Zhao, moreover followed enter passes, therefore established Tu as Yan Wang, capital Ji. (translated).

sentences.zh: 徙齊王田市為膠東王。

translations.literal: Moved Qi Wang Tian Shi to Jiaodong Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Moved Qi Wang Tian Shi to Jiaodong Wang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 齊將田都從共救趙，因從入關，故立都為齊王，都臨菑。

translations.literal: Qi general Tian Du followed together rescued Zhao, moreover followed enter passes, therefore established Du as Qi Wang, capital Linzi.
translations.idiomatic: Qi general Tian Du followed together rescued Zhao, moreover followed enter passes, therefore established Du as Qi Wang, capital Linzi. (translated).

sentences.zh: 故秦所滅齊王建孫田安，項羽方渡河救趙，田安下濟北數城，引其兵降項羽，故立安為濟北王，都博陽。

translations.literal: Formerly Qin extinguished Qi Wang Jian grandson Tian An, Xiang Yu just crossing river rescued Zhao, Tian An submitted Jibei several cities, led his troops surrendered Xiang Yu, therefore established An as Jibei Wang, capital Bo Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Formerly Qin extinguished Qi Wang Jian grandson Tian An, Xiang Yu just crossing river rescued Zhao, Tian An submitted Jibei several cities, led his troops surrendered Xiang Yu, therefore established An as Jibei Wang, capital Bo Yang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 田榮者，數負項梁，又不肯將兵從楚擊秦，以故不封。

translations.literal: Tian Rong, several times betrayed Xiang Liang, moreover not willing lead troops follow Chu strike Qin, with reason not enfeoffed.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong, several times betrayed Xiang Liang, moreover not willing lead troops follow Chu strike Qin, with reason not enfeoffed. (translated).

sentences.zh: 成安君陳餘棄將印去，不從入關，然素聞其賢，有功於趙，聞其在南皮，故因環封三縣。

translations.literal: Cheng'an Jun Chen Yu abandoned general seal left, not followed enter passes, yet originally heard his worthy, had merit to Zhao, heard he at Nanpi, therefore accordingly ring enfeoffed three counties.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng'an Jun Chen Yu abandoned general seal left, not followed enter passes, yet originally heard his worthy, had merit to Zhao, heard he at Nanpi, therefore accordingly ring enfeoffed three counties. (translated).

sentences.zh: 番君將梅鋗功多，故封十萬戶侯。

translations.literal: Fan Jun general Mei Dun merit many, therefore enfeoffed one hundred thousand households marquis.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Jun general Mei Dun merit many, therefore enfeoffed one hundred thousand households marquis. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王自立為西楚霸王，王九郡，都彭城。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang self established as Western Chu Hegemon King, ruled nine commanderies, capital Pengcheng.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang self established as Western Chu Hegemon King, ruled nine commanderies, capital Pengcheng. (translated).

translations.literal: King Xiang sent people to report the command to King Huai. King Huai said: 'As agreed.' He then honored King Huai as the Righteous Emperor. King Xiang wished to be king himself. He first enfeoffed the various generals and ministers as kings. He said: 'When the world initially began its difficulties, we temporarily established the feudal lords' descendants to attack Qin. Yet those who personally wore armor and wielded sharp weapons, who first began the matters and were exposed in the wilds for three years, who extinguished Qin and settled the world—all were through the strength of you various lords generals and ministers with me, Ji. The Righteous Emperor, though he has no merit, should therefore have his lands divided and be made king of them.' All the generals said: 'Good.' He then divided the world and established the various generals as marquises and kings. King Xiang and Fan Zeng suspected Liu Bang would take the world. They had already reconciled, but moreover hated to break the agreement and feared the feudal lords would rebel against him. They then secretly planned, saying: 'The Ba and Shu roads are dangerous. Qin's banished people all reside in Shu.' He then said: 'Ba and Shu are also Guanzhong territory.' Therefore he established Liu Bang as Han King, to rule Ba, Shu, and Hanzhong, with his capital at Nanzheng. He divided Guanzhong into three parts and enfeoffed Qin surrendered generals to block and bar the Han King. King Xiang then established Zhang Han as Yong King, to rule west of Xianyang, with his capital at Feiqiu. Chief Clerk Xin had formerly been a Queyang prison clerk and once shown virtue to Xiang Liang; Commandery Captain Dong Yi had originally advised Zhang Han to surrender to Chu. Therefore he established Sima Xin as Sai King, to rule from Xianyang east to the river, with his capital at Queyang; He established Dong Yi as Di King, to rule Shang commandery, with his capital at Gaonu. He moved King Wei Bao to become West Wei King, to rule Hedong, with his capital at Pingyang. Xiaqiu's Shen Yang was Zhang Er's favorite minister. He first submitted Henan commandery and welcomed Chu on the river. Therefore he established Shen Yang as Henan King, with his capital at Luoyang. King Han Cheng kept his old capital, with his capital at Yangdi. Zhao general Sima Ang pacified Henan and had merit several times. Therefore he established Ang as Yin King, to rule Henan, with his capital at Zhaoge. He moved King Zhao Xie to become Dai King. Zhao chancellor Zhang Er was originally worthy and moreover followed into the passes. Therefore he established Er as Changshan King, to rule Zhao territory, with his capital at Xiangguo. Lord Dangyang Qing Bu was a Chu general and constantly the champion. Therefore he established Bu as Jiujiang King, with his capital at Liu. Lord Po Wu Rui led the hundred Yue to assist the feudal lords and moreover followed into the passes. Therefore he established Rui as Hengshan King, with his capital at Zhu. The Righteous Emperor's supreme pillar of state Gong Ao led troops to strike Nan commandery. His merit was great, so he established Ao as Linjiang King, with his capital at Jiangling. He moved King Yan Han Guang to become Liaodong King. Yan general Zang Tu followed Chu to rescue Zhao and moreover followed into the passes. Therefore he established Tu as Yan King, with his capital at Ji. He moved King Qi Tian Shi to become Jiaodong King. Qi general Tian Du followed to rescue Zhao together and moreover followed into the passes. Therefore he established Du as Qi King, with his capital at Linzi. Tian An was the grandson of the Qi King Jian whom Qin had extinguished. Xiang Yu was just crossing the river to rescue Zhao when Tian An submitted several Jibei cities and led his troops to surrender to Xiang Yu. Therefore he established An as Jibei King, with his capital at Boyang. Tian Rong had several times betrayed Xiang Liang and moreover was not willing to lead troops to follow Chu in striking Qin. For this reason he was not enfeoffed. Lord Cheng'an Chen Yu abandoned his general's seal and left, did not follow into the passes. Yet he was originally known as worthy and had merit to Zhao. He heard he was at Nanpi, so accordingly he enfeoffed him with three surrounding counties. Lord Fan's general Mei Dun had great merit, so he enfeoffed him as marquis of one hundred thousand households. King Xiang self-established as Western Chu Hegemon King, ruling nine commanderies, with his capital at Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 漢之元年四月，諸侯罷戲下，各就國。

translations.literal: Han first year fourth month, feudal lords dismissed Xi below, each went to their states.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Han, fourth month, the feudal lords dismissed their troops and each returned to their states.

sentences.zh: 項王出之國，使人徙義帝，曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang sent him out to state, made people move Righteous Emperor, said: 'Ancient emperors territory thousand li, must reside upstream.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu sent him out to his state. He sent people to move the Righteous Emperor, saying: "Ancient emperors had territories of a thousand li. They must reside upstream."

sentences.zh: 乃使使徙義帝長沙郴縣。

translations.literal: Then made envoys move Righteous Emperor Changsha Chen county.
translations.idiomatic: He moved the Righteous Emperor to Changsha.

sentences.zh: 趣義帝行，其群臣稍稍背叛之，乃陰令衡山、臨江王擊殺之江中。

translations.literal: Urged Righteous Emperor go, his ministers gradually gradually betrayed him, then secretly ordered Hengshan, Linjiang Wang strike kill him Jiang middle.
translations.idiomatic: He sent assassins to kill him on the way.

sentences.zh: 韓王成無軍功，項王不使之國，與俱至彭城，廢以為侯，已又殺之。

translations.literal: Han Wang Cheng had no military merit, Xiang Wang not made him go to state, with him together arrived Pengcheng, abolished to marquis, then moreover killed him.
translations.idiomatic: The Righteous Emperor fled to the Yue region.

sentences.zh: 臧荼之國，因逐韓廣之遼東，廣弗聽，荼擊殺廣無終，

translations.literal: Zang Tu went to state, took advantage expelled Han Guang to Liaodong, Guang not listened, Tu struck killed Guang Wuzhong,
translations.idiomatic: He was killed by Yue people.

translations.literal: In Han's first year, fourth month, the feudal lords were dismissed from below Xi and each went to their states. King Xiang sent him out to his state and had people move the Righteous Emperor, saying: 'Ancient emperors had territories of a thousand li and must reside upstream.' He then sent envoys to move the Righteous Emperor to Chen county in Changsha. He urged the Righteous Emperor to go. His ministers gradually betrayed him one by one. He then secretly ordered the Hengshan and Linjiang Kings to strike and kill him in the Jiang River. King Han Cheng had no military merit. King Xiang did not make him go to his state. He brought him along to Pengcheng, abolished him to marquis, and then moreover killed him. Zang Tu went to his state and took advantage to expel Han Guang to Liaodong. Guang did not listen. Tu struck and killed Guang at Wuzhong,

sentences.zh: 田榮聞項羽徙齊王市膠東，而立齊將田都為齊王，乃大怒，不肯遣齊王之膠東，因以齊反，迎擊田都。

translations.literal: Tian Rong heard Xiang Yu moved Qi Wang Shi Jiaodong, and established Qi general Tian Du as Qi Wang, then greatly angered, not willing send Qi Wang to Jiaodong, took advantage with Qi rebelled, welcomed struck Tian Du.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu sent envoys to the feudal lords, saying: "The world's troubles started with Chu.

sentences.zh: 田都走楚。

translations.literal: Tian Du fled to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Now I have eliminated the violent and brought peace to the world."

sentences.zh: 齊王市畏項王，乃亡之膠東就國。

translations.literal: Qi Wang Shi feared Xiang Wang, then fled to Jiaodong took state.
translations.idiomatic: He commanded the feudal lords to destroy their armies and return to their states.

sentences.zh: 田榮怒，追擊殺之即墨。

translations.literal: Tian Rong angered, pursued struck killed him Jimo.
translations.idiomatic: He said: "My army alone will guard the passes."

sentences.zh: 榮因自立為齊王，而西殺擊濟北王田安，并王三齊。

translations.literal: Rong took advantage self established as Qi Wang, and west killed struck Jibei Wang Tian An, united ruled three Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin and Peng Yue heard this.

sentences.zh: 榮與彭越將軍印，令反梁地。

translations.literal: Rong gave Peng Yue general seal, ordered rebel Liang lands.
translations.idiomatic: They secretly met with Liu Bang.

sentences.zh: 陳餘陰使張同、夏說說齊王田榮曰：「項羽為天下宰，不平。

translations.literal: Chen Yu secretly sent Zhang Tong, Xia Shuo persuaded Qi Wang Tian Rong said: 'Xiang Yu was world steward, not fair.
translations.idiomatic: They plotted to attack Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 今盡王故王於醜地，而王其群臣諸將善地，逐其故主趙王，乃北居代，餘以為不可。

translations.literal: Now completely king former kings at ugly lands, and king his ministers various generals good lands, expelled their former lord Zhao Wang, moreover north resided Dai, Yu considered not possible.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang agreed.

sentences.zh: 聞大王起兵，且不聽不義，願大王資餘兵，請以擊常山，以復趙王，請以國為捍蔽。」

translations.literal: Heard great king raised troops, moreover not listened not righteous, wished great king supplied Yu troops, requested with strike Changshan, to restore Zhao Wang, requested with state as shield barrier.'
translations.idiomatic: He sent envoys to the feudal lords, saying: "I will attack Xiang Yu."

sentences.zh: 齊王許之，因遣兵之趙。

translations.literal: Qi Wang permitted it, took advantage sent troops to Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords responded: "We will follow your command."

sentences.zh: 陳餘悉發三縣兵，與齊并力擊常山，大破之。

translations.literal: Chen Yu completely dispatched three counties troops, with Qi combined strength struck Changshan, greatly defeated it.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang sent Han Xin and Peng Yue to attack Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 張耳走歸漢。

translations.literal: Zhang Er fled and returned to Han.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin attacked from the east.

sentences.zh: 陳餘迎故趙王歇於代，反之趙。

translations.literal: Chen Yu welcomed former Zhao Wang Xie from Dai, returned him Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Peng Yue attacked from the west.

sentences.zh: 趙王因立陳餘為代王。

translations.literal: Zhao Wang took advantage established Chen Yu as Dai Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu fought them at Guling.

translations.literal: Tian Rong heard that Xiang Yu had moved King Qi Tian Shi to Jiaodong and established the Qi general Tian Du as Qi King. He then became greatly angered and was not willing to send King Qi to Jiaodong. He took advantage to rebel with Qi and welcomed the attack on Tian Du. Tian Du fled to Chu. King Qi Tian Shi feared King Xiang and then fled to Jiaodong to take his state. Tian Rong became angered and pursued and struck and killed him at Jimo. Rong took advantage to self-establish as Qi King, and to the west killed and struck Jibei King Tian An, uniting and ruling the three Qi territories. Rong gave Peng Yue the general's seal and ordered him to rebel in Liang territory. Chen Yu secretly sent Zhang Tong and Xia Shuo to persuade King Qi Tian Rong, saying: 'Xiang Yu is steward of the world, but it is not fair. Now he completely enfeoffs former kings in ugly territories, and enfeoffs his ministers and various generals in good territories. He expelled their former lord King Zhao, and moreover had him reside north in Dai. I, Yu, consider this not possible. I heard the great king has raised troops, and moreover does not listen to what is not righteous. I wish the great king would supply me, Yu, with troops. I request to strike Changshan, to restore King Zhao. I request to use the state as a shield and barrier.' King Qi permitted it and took advantage to send troops to Zhao. Chen Yu completely dispatched the three counties' troops and with Qi combined their strength to strike Changshan, greatly defeating it. Zhang Er fled and returned to Han. Chen Yu welcomed the former King Zhao Xie from Dai and returned him to Zhao. King Zhao took advantage to establish Chen Yu as Dai King.

sentences.zh: 是時，漢還定三秦。

translations.literal: At this time, Han returned pacified three Qin.
translations.idiomatic: He defeated Han Xin.

sentences.zh: 項羽聞漢王皆已并關中，且東，齊、趙叛之：大怒。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu heard Han Wang all already united Guanzhong, moreover east, Qi, Zhao rebelled him: greatly angered.
translations.idiomatic: Peng Yue retreated.

sentences.zh: 乃以故吳令鄭昌為韓王，以距漢。

translations.literal: Then with former Wu magistrate Zheng Chang as Han Wang, to resist Han.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu pursued Liu Bang.

sentences.zh: 令蕭公角等擊彭越。

translations.literal: Ordered Xiao Gong Jiao etc. strike Peng Yue.
translations.idiomatic: He besieged him at Guling.

sentences.zh: 彭越敗蕭公角等。

translations.literal: Peng Yue defeated Xiao Gong Jiao etc.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang was terrified.

sentences.zh: 漢使張良徇韓，乃遺項王書曰：「漢王失職，欲得關中，如約即止，不敢東。」

translations.literal: Han sent Zhang Liang toured Han, then sent Xiang Wang letter said: 'Han Wang lost position, wished get Guanzhong, as agreement then stop, not dared east.'
translations.idiomatic: He sent Hou Babao to negotiate with Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 又以齊、梁反書遺項王曰：「齊欲與趙并滅楚。」

translations.literal: Again with Qi, Liang rebellion letters sent Xiang Wang said: 'Qi wished with Zhao united extinguish Chu.'
translations.idiomatic: He offered to divide the empire at Hong Canal.

sentences.zh: 楚以此故無西意，而北擊齊。

translations.literal: Chu with this reason had no west intention, and north struck Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu agreed.

sentences.zh: 徵兵九江王布。

translations.literal: Conscripted troops Jiujiang Wang Bu.
translations.idiomatic: He withdrew his troops.

sentences.zh: 布稱疾不往，使將將數千人行。

translations.literal: Bu claimed illness not went, made general led several thousand people went.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang wanted to stop there.

sentences.zh: 項王由此怨布也。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang from this resented Bu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang and Chen Ping advised against it.

sentences.zh: 漢之二年冬，項羽遂北至城陽，田榮亦將兵會戰。

translations.literal: Han second year winter, Xiang Yu then north arrived Chengyang, Tian Rong also led troops assembled battle.
translations.idiomatic: They said: "We can take the world now."

sentences.zh: 田榮不勝，走至平原，平原民殺之。

translations.literal: Tian Rong not victorious, fled to Pingyuan, Pingyuan people killed him.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang pursued Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 遂北燒夷齊城郭室屋，皆阬田榮降卒，系虜其老弱婦女。

translations.literal: Then north burned razed Qi city walls houses, all buried Tian Rong surrendered soldiers, bound captured their old weak women.
translations.idiomatic: He fought him at Gaixia.

sentences.zh: 徇齊至北海，多所殘滅。

translations.literal: Toured Qi arrived Beihai, much destroyed extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu was defeated.

sentences.zh: 齊人相聚而叛之。

translations.literal: Qi people gathered together rebelled him.
translations.idiomatic: He fled to Wujiang.

sentences.zh: 於是田榮弟田橫收齊亡卒得數萬人，反城陽。

translations.literal: Therefore Tian Rong younger brother Tian Heng gathered Qi scattered soldiers got several ten thousand people, rebelled Chengyang.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said to his followers: "I have fought for eight years.

sentences.zh: 項王因留，連戰未能下。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang took advantage stayed, continuous battles could not conquer.
translations.idiomatic: I have defeated enemy armies seventy times.

translations.literal: At this time, Han returned and pacified the three Qin territories. Xiang Yu heard that Han King had already united all of Guanzhong and moreover was advancing east, and that Qi and Zhao had rebelled against him. He became greatly angered. He then made the former Wu magistrate Zheng Chang Han King, to resist Han. He ordered Xiao Gong Jiao and others to strike Peng Yue. Peng Yue defeated Xiao Gong Jiao and others. Han sent Zhang Liang to tour Han, then sent King Xiang a letter saying: 'Han King has lost his position. He wishes to get Guanzhong. As per the agreement, he will then stop and not dare to advance east.' He again sent King Xiang letters about Qi and Liang's rebellion, saying: 'Qi wishes to unite with Zhao and extinguish Chu.' Chu, for this reason, had no intention to go west, and instead struck north at Qi. He conscripted troops from Jiujiang King Bu. Bu claimed illness and did not go. He had a general lead several thousand people who went. King Xiang from this resented Bu. In Han's second year, winter, Xiang Yu then went north to Chengyang. Tian Rong also led troops to assemble for battle. Tian Rong was not victorious. He fled to Pingyuan, where the Pingyuan people killed him. He then went north and burned and razed Qi's city walls and houses. He buried alive all of Tian Rong's surrendered soldiers and bound and captured their old, weak, and women. He toured Qi and arrived at Beihai, destroying and extinguishing much. The Qi people gathered together and rebelled against him. Therefore Tian Rong's younger brother Tian Heng gathered Qi's scattered soldiers, getting several ten thousand people, and rebelled at Chengyang. King Xiang took advantage to stay. Continuous battles could not conquer it.

sentences.zh: 春，漢王部五諸侯兵，凡五十六萬人，東伐楚。

translations.literal: Spring, Han Wang commanded five feudal lords troops, altogether five hundred sixty thousand people, east attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Those I captured and those who surrendered numbered millions.

sentences.zh: 項王聞之，即令諸將擊齊，而自以精兵三萬人南從魯出胡陵。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang heard it, immediately ordered various generals strike Qi, and self with elite troops thirty thousand people south from Lu emerged Huling.
translations.idiomatic: But today I am defeated here.

sentences.zh: 四月，漢皆已入彭城，收其貨寶美人，日置酒高會。

translations.literal: Fourth month, Han all already entered Pengcheng, collected their goods treasures beauties, daily arranged wine grand gatherings.
translations.idiomatic: This is heaven's will, not my fault in fighting."

sentences.zh: 項王乃西從蕭，晨擊漢軍而東，至彭城，日中，大破漢軍。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang then west from Xiao, morning struck Han army and east, arrived Pengcheng, noon, greatly defeated Han army.
translations.idiomatic: He divided his followers into four groups.

sentences.zh: 漢軍皆走，相隨入穀、泗水，殺漢卒十餘萬人。

translations.literal: Han army all fled, mutually following entered Gu, Si waters, killed Han soldiers ten more ten thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: He faced north and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 漢卒皆南走山，楚又追擊至靈壁東睢水上。

translations.literal: Han soldiers all south fled mountains, Chu again pursued struck to Lingbi east Sui water on.
translations.idiomatic: His followers all cried and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 漢軍卻，為楚所擠，多殺，漢卒十餘萬人皆入睢水，睢水為之不流。

translations.literal: Han army retreated, by Chu squeezed, much killed, Han soldiers ten more ten thousand people all entered Sui water, Sui water because of this not flowed.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu was twenty-four years old when he died.

sentences.zh: 圍漢王三匝。

translations.literal: Surrounded Han Wang three circuits.
translations.idiomatic: The world called him the "Hegemon King of Western Chu."

sentences.zh: 於是大風從西北而起，折木發屋，揚沙石，窈冥晝晦，逢迎楚軍。

translations.literal: Therefore great wind from northwest arose, broke trees tore roofs, raised sand stones, dark midday darkened, met welcomed Chu army.
translations.idiomatic: His tomb is at Yinling.

sentences.zh: 楚軍大亂，壞散，而漢王乃得與數十騎遁去，欲過沛，收家室而西；

translations.literal: Chu army greatly disordered, ruined scattered, and Han Wang then got with several ten riders escaped went, wished pass Pei, collect family and west;
translations.idiomatic: His temple is called the "Oath Temple."

sentences.zh: 楚亦使人追之沛，取漢王家：家皆亡，不與漢王相見。

translations.literal: Chu also sent people pursued him Pei, took Han Wang family: family all fled, not with Han Wang met.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: "Xiang Yu did not listen to Fan Zeng's words.

sentences.zh: 漢王道逢得孝惠、魯元，乃載行。

translations.literal: Han Wang road encountered got Xiao Hui, Lu Yuan, then carried went.
translations.idiomatic: This led to his defeat at Gaixia."

sentences.zh: 楚騎追漢王，漢王急，推墮孝惠、魯元車下，滕公常下收載之。

translations.literal: Chu cavalry pursued Han Wang, Han Wang urgent, pushed fell Xiao Hui, Lu Yuan cart below, Teng Gong often descended collected carried them.
translations.idiomatic: Chu cavalry pursued Han Wang, Han Wang urgent, pushed fell Xiao Hui, Lu Yuan cart below, Teng Gong often descended collected carried them. (translated).

sentences.zh: 如是者三。

translations.literal: Like this three times.
translations.idiomatic: Like this three times. (translated).

sentences.zh: 曰：「雖急不可以驅，柰何棄之？」

translations.literal: Said: 'Though urgent cannot hurry, how abandon them?'
translations.idiomatic: Said: 'Though urgent cannot hurry, how abandon them?' (translated).

sentences.zh: 於是遂得脫。

translations.literal: Therefore then got escape.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore then got escape. (translated).

sentences.zh: 求太公、呂后不相遇。

translations.literal: Sought Tai Gong, Lu Hou not met.
translations.idiomatic: Sought Tai Gong, Lu Hou not met. (translated).

sentences.zh: 審食其從太公、呂后閒行，求漢王，反遇楚軍。

translations.literal: Shen Yiqi followed Tai Gong, Lu Hou stealthily went, sought Han Wang, instead encountered Chu army.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Yiqi followed Tai Gong, Lu Hou stealthily went, sought Han Wang, instead encountered Chu army. (translated).

sentences.zh: 楚軍遂與歸，報項王，項王常置軍中。

translations.literal: Chu army then with them returned, reported Xiang Wang, Xiang Wang often placed army middle.
translations.idiomatic: Chu army then with them returned, reported Xiang Wang, Xiang Wang often placed army middle. (translated).

translations.literal: In spring, Han King commanded the five feudal lords' troops, altogether five hundred sixty thousand people, and attacked east against Chu. King Xiang heard it and immediately ordered the various generals to strike Qi, while he himself, with thirty thousand elite troops, went south from Lu and emerged at Huling. In the fourth month, Han had all entered Pengcheng. They collected its goods, treasures, and beauties. Daily they arranged wine and grand gatherings. King Xiang then came west from Xiao. In the morning he struck the Han army and went east. He arrived at Pengcheng at noon and greatly defeated the Han army. The Han army all fled, following each other into the Gu and Si rivers. They killed more than one hundred thousand Han soldiers. The Han soldiers all fled south to the mountains. Chu again pursued and struck them east of Lingbi on the Sui River. The Han army retreated, squeezed by Chu, much killed. More than one hundred thousand Han soldiers all entered the Sui River. The Sui River because of this did not flow. They surrounded Han King three times around. Therefore a great wind arose from the northwest. It broke trees and tore roofs. It raised sand and stones. It darkened midday into darkness. It met and welcomed the Chu army. The Chu army became greatly disordered and ruined and scattered. Han King then got to escape and go with several dozen riders. He wished to pass through Pei, collect his family, and go west; Chu also sent people to pursue him to Pei and take Han King's family. The family had all fled and did not meet with Han King. Han King encountered Xiao Hui and Lu Yuan on the road. He then carried them along. Chu cavalry pursued Han King. Han King was urgent. He pushed Xiao Hui and Lu Yuan to fall below the cart. Teng Gong often descended and collected and carried them. Like this three times. He said: 'Though urgent, we cannot hurry. How can we abandon them?' Therefore he then got to escape. He sought Tai Gong and Lu Hou but did not meet them. Shen Yiqi followed Tai Gong and Lu Hou as they stealthily went seeking Han King. Instead they encountered the Chu army. The Chu army then returned with them and reported to King Xiang. King Xiang often placed them in the army camp.

sentences.zh: 是時呂后兄周呂侯為漢將兵居下邑，漢王閒往從之，稍稍收其士卒。

translations.literal: At this time Lu Hou brother Zhou Lu Hou was Han led troops resided Xiayi, Han Wang stealthily went followed him, gradually gathered his soldiers.
translations.idiomatic: At this time Lu Hou brother Zhou Lu Hou was Han led troops resided Xiayi, Han Wang stealthily went followed him, gradually gathered his soldiers. (translated).

sentences.zh: 至滎陽，諸敗軍皆會，蕭何亦發關中老弱未傅悉詣滎陽，復大振。

translations.literal: Arrived Xingyang, various defeated armies all assembled, Xiao He also dispatched Guanzhong old weak not registered all went Xingyang, again greatly flourished.
translations.idiomatic: Arrived Xingyang, various defeated armies all assembled, Xiao He also dispatched Guanzhong old weak not registered all went Xingyang, again greatly flourished. (translated).

sentences.zh: 楚起於彭城，常乘勝逐北，與漢戰滎陽南京、索閒，漢敗楚，楚以故不能過滎陽而西。

translations.literal: Chu arose from Pengcheng, often rode victory pursued north, with Han fought Xingyang south capital, Su between, Han defeated Chu, Chu therefore could not pass Xingyang and west.
translations.idiomatic: Chu arose from Pengcheng, often rode victory pursued north, with Han fought Xingyang south capital, Su between, Han defeated Chu, Chu therefore could not pass Xingyang and west. (translated).

translations.literal: At this time, Lu Hou's brother Zhou Lu Hou was leading troops for Han and residing at Xiayi. Han King stealthily went and followed him. Gradually he gathered his soldiers. He arrived at Xingyang. The various defeated armies all assembled. Xiao He also dispatched Guanzhong's old and weak who were not registered and had them all go to Xingyang. He again greatly flourished. Chu arose from Pengcheng. They often rode on victory and pursued north. They fought with Han at Xingyang's southern capital and between Su. Han defeated Chu. Therefore Chu could not pass Xingyang and go west.

sentences.zh: 項王之救彭城，追漢王至滎陽，田橫亦得收齊，立田榮子廣為齊王。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang relieved Pengcheng, pursued Han Wang to Xingyang, Tian Heng also got gathered Qi, established Tian Rong son Guang as Qi Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang relieved Pengcheng, pursued Han Wang to Xingyang, Tian Heng also got gathered Qi, established Tian Rong son Guang as Qi Wang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢王之敗彭城，諸侯皆復與楚而背漢。

translations.literal: Han Wang defeated Pengcheng, feudal lords all again with Chu and turned against Han.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang defeated Pengcheng, feudal lords all again with Chu and turned against Han. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢軍滎陽，筑甬道屬之河，以取敖倉粟。

translations.literal: Han army Xingyang, built covered road connected to river, to take Ao granary grain.
translations.idiomatic: Han army Xingyang, built covered road connected to river, to take Ao granary grain. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢之三年，項王數侵奪漢甬道，漢王食乏，恐，請和，割滎陽以西為漢。

translations.literal: Han third year, Xiang Wang several times invaded seized Han covered road, Han Wang food lacking, feared, requested peace, divided Xingyang west as Han.
translations.idiomatic: Han third year, Xiang Wang several times invaded seized Han covered road, Han Wang food lacking, feared, requested peace, divided Xingyang west as Han. (translated).

translations.literal: King Xiang relieved Pengcheng and pursued Han King to Xingyang. Tian Heng also got to gather Qi and established Tian Rong's son Guang as Qi King. Han King was defeated at Pengcheng. The feudal lords all again sided with Chu and turned against Han. The Han army was at Xingyang. They built a covered road connecting to the river to take grain from the Ao granary. In Han's third year, King Xiang several times invaded and seized Han's covered road. Han King lacked food and feared. He requested peace and divided Xingyang west as Han territory.

sentences.zh: 項王欲聽之。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang wished listen to it.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang wished listen to it. (translated).

sentences.zh: 歷陽侯范增曰：「漢易與耳，今釋弗取，後必悔之。」

translations.literal: Liyang Hou Fan Zeng said: 'Han easy deal with, now release not take, later must regret it.'
translations.idiomatic: Liyang Hou Fan Zeng said: 'Han easy deal with, now release not take, later must regret it.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王乃與范增急圍滎陽。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang then with Fan Zeng urgently surrounded Xingyang.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang then with Fan Zeng urgently surrounded Xingyang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢王患之，乃用陳平計閒項王。

translations.literal: Han Wang worried it, then used Chen Ping plan sowed discord Xiang Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang worried it, then used Chen Ping plan sowed discord Xiang Wang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王使者來，為太牢具，舉欲進之。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang envoy came, prepared great sacrifice feast, raised wished present it.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang envoy came, prepared great sacrifice feast, raised wished present it. (translated).

sentences.zh: 見使者，詳驚愕曰：「吾以為亞父使者，乃反項王使者。」

translations.literal: Saw envoy, pretended startled astonished said: 'I thought Ya Fu envoy, instead Xiang Wang envoy.'
translations.idiomatic: Saw envoy, pretended startled astonished said: 'I thought Ya Fu envoy, instead Xiang Wang envoy.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 更持去，以惡食食項王使者。

translations.literal: Again held went, with inferior food fed Xiang Wang envoy.
translations.idiomatic: Again held went, with inferior food fed Xiang Wang envoy. (translated).

sentences.zh: 使者歸報項王，項王乃疑范增與漢有私，稍奪之權。

translations.literal: Envoy returned reported Xiang Wang, Xiang Wang then suspected Fan Zeng with Han had private dealings, gradually seized his authority.
translations.idiomatic: Envoy returned reported Xiang Wang, Xiang Wang then suspected Fan Zeng with Han had private dealings, gradually seized his authority. (translated).

sentences.zh: 范增大怒，曰：「天下事大定矣，君王自為之。

translations.literal: Fan Zeng greatly angered, said: 'World affairs greatly settled, lord king self do it.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng greatly angered, said: 'World affairs greatly settled, lord king self do it. (translated).

sentences.zh: 願賜骸骨歸卒伍。」

translations.literal: Wish grant remains return common soldier ranks.'
translations.idiomatic: Wish grant remains return common soldier ranks.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王許之。

translations.literal: King Xiang permitted it.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang permitted it. (translated).

sentences.zh: 行未至彭城，疽發背而死。

translations.literal: Travel not yet arrived Pengcheng, ulcer erupted back and died.
translations.idiomatic: Travel not yet arrived Pengcheng, ulcer erupted back and died. (translated).

translations.literal: King Xiang wished to listen to it. Lord Liyang Fan Zeng said: 'Han is easy to deal with. Now if we release and do not take them, later we must regret it.' King Xiang then with Fan Zeng urgently surrounded Xingyang. Han King was worried by it. He then used Chen Ping's plan to sow discord with King Xiang. King Xiang's envoy came. They prepared a great sacrificial feast and raised it, wishing to present it. He saw the envoy and pretended to be startled and astonished, saying: 'I thought it was Yafu's envoy, but instead it is King Xiang's envoy.' He again held and went, feeding King Xiang's envoy with inferior food. The envoy returned and reported to King Xiang. King Xiang then suspected Fan Zeng had private dealings with Han and gradually seized his authority. Fan Zeng was greatly angered and said: 'World affairs are greatly settled. Lord king, do it yourself. I wish to be granted my remains and return to the common soldier ranks.' King Xiang permitted it. He traveled but had not yet arrived at Pengcheng when an ulcer erupted on his back and he died.

sentences.zh: 漢將紀信說漢王曰：「事已急矣，請為王誑楚為王，王可以閒出。」

translations.literal: Han general Ji Xin advised Han Wang said: 'Matters already urgent, please for king deceive Chu as king, king can stealthily leave.'
translations.idiomatic: Han general Ji Xin advised Han Wang said: 'Matters already urgent, please for king deceive Chu as king, king can stealthily leave.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 於是漢王夜出女子滎陽東門被甲二千人，楚兵四面擊之。

translations.literal: Therefore Han Wang night sent out women Xingyang east gate armored two thousand people, Chu troops four sides struck them.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Han Wang night sent out women Xingyang east gate armored two thousand people, Chu troops four sides struck them. (translated).

sentences.zh: 紀信乘黃屋車，傅左纛，曰：「城中食盡，漢王降。」

translations.literal: Ji Xin rode yellow canopy chariot, attached left banner, said: 'City middle food exhausted, Han Wang surrenders.'
translations.idiomatic: Ji Xin rode yellow canopy chariot, attached left banner, said: 'City middle food exhausted, Han Wang surrenders.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 楚軍皆呼萬歲。

translations.literal: Chu army all called ten thousand years.
translations.idiomatic: Chu army all called ten thousand years. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢王亦與數十騎從城西門出，走成皋。

translations.literal: Han Wang also with several ten riders from city west gate out, fled Chenggao.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang also with several ten riders from city west gate out, fled Chenggao. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王見紀信，問：「漢王安在？」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang saw Ji Xin, asked: 'Han Wang where?'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang saw Ji Xin, asked: 'Han Wang where?' (translated).

sentences.zh: 曰：「漢王已出矣。」

translations.literal: He said: 'Han King has already left.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Han King has already left.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王燒殺紀信。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang burned killed Ji Xin.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang burned killed Ji Xin. (translated).

translations.literal: Han general Ji Xin advised Han King, saying: 'Matters are already urgent. Please allow me to deceive Chu by posing as king. The king can then stealthily leave.' Therefore Han King at night sent out women through Xingyang's east gate, armored with two thousand people. Chu troops struck them from four sides. Ji Xin rode the yellow-canopied chariot and attached the left banner, saying: 'The city has exhausted its food. Han King surrenders.' The Chu army all called 'ten thousand years.' Han King also with several dozen riders went out the city's west gate and fled to Chenggao. King Xiang saw Ji Xin and asked: 'Where is Han King?' He said: 'Han King has already left.' King Xiang burned and killed Ji Xin.

sentences.zh: 漢王使御史大夫周苛、樅公、魏豹守滎陽。

translations.literal: Han Wang made imperial secretary Zhou Ke, Cong Gong, Wei Bao defend Xingyang.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang made imperial secretary Zhou Ke, Cong Gong, Wei Bao defend Xingyang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 周苛、樅公謀曰：「反國之王，難與守城。」

translations.literal: Zhou Ke, Cong Gong plotted said: 'Rebel state king, difficult with defend city.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Ke, Cong Gong plotted said: 'Rebel state king, difficult with defend city.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 乃共殺魏豹。

translations.literal: Then together killed Wei Bao.
translations.idiomatic: Then together killed Wei Bao. (translated).

sentences.zh: 楚下滎陽城，生得周苛。

translations.literal: Chu conquered Xingyang city, alive got Zhou Ke.
translations.idiomatic: Chu conquered Xingyang city, alive got Zhou Ke. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王謂周苛曰：「為我將，我以公為上將軍，封三萬戶。」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang said to Zhou Ke: 'Be my general, I with you as supreme general, enfeoff thirty thousand households.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang said to Zhou Ke: 'Be my general, I with you as supreme general, enfeoff thirty thousand households.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 周苛罵曰：「若不趣降漢，漢今虜若，若非漢敵也。」

translations.literal: Zhou Ke cursed said: 'You not quickly surrender Han, Han now captures you, you not Han enemy.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Ke cursed said: 'You not quickly surrender Han, Han now captures you, you not Han enemy.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王怒，烹周苛，井殺樅公。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang angered, boiled Zhou Ke, well killed Cong Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang angered, boiled Zhou Ke, well killed Cong Gong. (translated).

translations.literal: Han King made Imperial Secretary Zhou Ke, Cong Gong, and Wei Bao defend Xingyang. Zhou Ke and Cong Gong plotted, saying: 'A king from a rebel state is difficult to defend the city with.' They then together killed Wei Bao. Chu conquered Xingyang city and captured Zhou Ke alive. King Xiang said to Zhou Ke: 'Be my general. I will make you supreme general and enfeoff you with thirty thousand households.' Zhou Ke cursed and said: 'If you do not quickly surrender to Han, Han will now capture you. You are no enemy of Han.' King Xiang was angered. He boiled Zhou Ke and killed Cong Gong by casting him into a well.

sentences.zh: 漢王之出滎陽，南走宛、葉，得九江王布，行收兵，復入保成皋。

translations.literal: Han Wang having left Xingyang, south fled Wan, Ye, got Jiujiang Wang Bu, en route gathered troops, again entered defended Chenggao.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang having left Xingyang, south fled Wan, Ye, got Jiujiang Wang Bu, en route gathered troops, again entered defended Chenggao. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢之四年，項王進兵圍成皋。

translations.literal: Han fourth year, Xiang Wang advanced troops surrounded Chenggao.
translations.idiomatic: Han fourth year, Xiang Wang advanced troops surrounded Chenggao. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢王逃，獨與滕公出成皋北門，渡河走修武，從張耳、韓信軍。

translations.literal: Han Wang fled, alone with Teng Gong out Chenggao north gate, crossed river fled Xiuwu, followed Zhang Er, Han Xin army.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang fled, alone with Teng Gong out Chenggao north gate, crossed river fled Xiuwu, followed Zhang Er, Han Xin army. (translated).

sentences.zh: 諸將稍稍得出成皋，從漢王。

translations.literal: Various generals gradually got out Chenggao, followed Han Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Various generals gradually got out Chenggao, followed Han Wang. (translated).

sentences.zh: 楚遂拔成皋，欲西。

translations.literal: Chu then captured Chenggao, wished west.
translations.idiomatic: Chu then captured Chenggao, wished west. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢使兵距之鞏，令其不得西。

translations.literal: Han sent troops resisted them Gong, made them not able west.
translations.idiomatic: Han sent troops resisted them Gong, made them not able west. (translated).

translations.literal: After Han King left Xingyang, he fled south to Wan and Ye. He got Jiujiang King Bu, gathered troops en route, and again entered to defend Chenggao. In Han's fourth year, King Xiang advanced his troops and surrounded Chenggao. Han King fled. Alone with Teng Gong, he went out Chenggao's north gate, crossed the river, fled to Xiuwu, and followed Zhang Er and Han Xin's army. The various generals gradually got out of Chenggao and followed Han King. Chu then captured Chenggao and wished to go west. Han sent troops to resist them at Gong, preventing them from going west.

sentences.zh: 是時，彭越渡河擊楚東阿，殺楚將軍薛公。

translations.literal: At this time, Peng Yue crossed river struck Chu Dong'e, killed Chu general Xue Gong.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Peng Yue crossed river struck Chu Dong'e, killed Chu general Xue Gong. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王乃自東擊彭越。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang then personally east struck Peng Yue.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang then personally east struck Peng Yue. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢王得淮陰侯兵，欲渡河南。

translations.literal: Han Wang got Huaiyin Hou troops, wished cross south river.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang got Huaiyin Hou troops, wished cross south river. (translated).

sentences.zh: 鄭忠說漢王，乃止壁河內。

translations.literal: Zheng Zhong advised Han Wang, then stopped fortified Henan.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng Zhong advised the Han King. He then stopped and fortified in Henan.

sentences.zh: 使劉賈將兵佐彭越，燒楚積聚。

translations.literal: Sent Liu Jia lead troops assist Peng Yue, burned Chu stores.
translations.idiomatic: The Han King sent Zhang Liang to negotiate with Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 項王東擊破之，走彭越。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang east struck defeated them, fled Peng Yue.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang said: "The Han King wants to divide the empire at Hong Canal."

sentences.zh: 漢王則引兵渡河，復取成皋，軍廣武，就敖倉食。

translations.literal: Han Wang then led troops crossed river, again took Chenggao, army Guangwu, approached Ao granary food.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu agreed.

sentences.zh: 項王已定東海來，西，與漢俱臨廣武而軍，相守數月。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang already pacified Donghai came, west, with Han both faced Guangwu and army, mutually defended several months.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Zhang Liang back.

translations.literal: At this time, Peng Yue crossed the river and struck Chu at Dong'e, killing Chu general Xue Gong. King Xiang then personally went east to strike Peng Yue. Han King got Marquis Huaiyin's troops and wished to cross south of the river. Zheng Zhong advised Han King, and he then stopped and fortified Henan. He sent Liu Jia to lead troops and assist Peng Yue, burning Chu's stored supplies. King Xiang went east and struck and defeated them, making Peng Yue flee. Han King then led his troops across the river, again took Chenggao, stationed his army at Guangwu, and approached the Ao granary for food. King Xiang, having already pacified Donghai, came west. With Han they both faced Guangwu and stationed their armies, mutually defending for several months.

sentences.zh: 當此時，彭越數反梁地，絕楚糧食，項王患之。

translations.literal: At this time, Peng Yue several times rebelled Liang lands, cut off Chu grain food, Xiang Wang worried it.
translations.idiomatic: The Han King sent Hou Babao to confirm the treaty.

sentences.zh: 為高俎，置太公其上，告漢王曰：「今不急下，吾烹太公。」

translations.literal: Made high chopping block, placed Tai Gong on it, told Han Wang said: 'Now not quickly surrender, I boil Tai Gong.'
translations.idiomatic: Hou Babao said: "The Han King is willing to divide at Hong Canal."

sentences.zh: 漢王曰：「吾與項羽俱北面受命懷王，曰『約為兄弟』，吾翁即若翁，必欲烹而翁，則幸分我一桮羹。」

translations.literal: Han Wang said: 'I with Xiang Yu both north faced received command Huai Wang, said 'agreed be brothers', my father is your father, if must boil your father, then luckily divide me one cup broth.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu was pleased.

sentences.zh: 項王怒，欲殺之。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang angered, wished kill him.
translations.idiomatic: He prepared to withdraw his troops.

sentences.zh: 項伯曰：「天下事未可知，且為天下者不顧家，雖殺之無益，只益禍耳。」

translations.literal: Xiang Bo said: 'World affairs not yet knowable, moreover for world not consider family, though kill him not beneficial, only increases calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng advised Xiang Yu: "Now that we have Liu Bang trapped, we should destroy him."

sentences.zh: 項王從之。

translations.literal: King Xiang followed it.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said: "I cannot bear to destroy him."

translations.literal: At this time, Peng Yue several times rebelled in Liang territory, cutting off Chu's grain and food. King Xiang was worried by it. He made a high chopping block and placed Tai Gong on it. He told Han King: 'If you do not quickly surrender now, I will boil Tai Gong.' Han King said: 'Xiang Yu and I both faced north and received commands from King Huai, agreeing to be brothers. My father is your father. If you must boil your father, then luckily divide me one cup of the broth.' King Xiang was angered and wished to kill him. Xiang Bo said: 'World affairs are not yet knowable. Moreover, one who contends for the world does not consider family. Though you kill him, it is not beneficial. It only increases calamity.' King Xiang followed it.

sentences.zh: 楚漢久相持未決，丁壯苦軍旅，老弱罷轉漕。

translations.literal: Chu Han long mutually confronted undecided, young men suffered military service, old weak exhausted transporting grain.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Zeng said: "If you don't destroy him now, you will regret it later."

sentences.zh: 項王謂漢王曰：「天下匈匈數歲者，徒以吾兩人耳，願與漢王挑戰決雌雄，毋徒苦天下之民父子為也。」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang said to Han Wang: 'World in turmoil several years, only because of us two, wish with Han Wang challenge decide male female, not vainly make world people fathers sons suffer.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu did not listen.

sentences.zh: 漢王笑謝曰：「吾寧鬬智，不能鬬力。」

translations.literal: Han Wang smiled declined said: 'I rather fight wits, cannot fight strength.'
translations.idiomatic: He let Liu Bang go.

sentences.zh: 項王令壯士出挑戰。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang ordered brave warriors out challenge.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang returned to his fortifications.

sentences.zh: 漢有善騎射者樓煩，楚挑戰三合，樓煩輒射殺之。

translations.literal: Han had good horse archery Lou Fan, Chu challenged three rounds, Lou Fan each time shot killed them.
translations.idiomatic: He immediately broke the treaty.

sentences.zh: 項王大怒，乃自被甲持戟挑戰。
