translations.literal: Xiang Wang greatly angered, then self donned armor held halberd challenged.
translations.idiomatic: He sent troops to pursue Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 樓煩欲射之，項王瞋目叱之，樓煩目不敢視，手不敢發，遂走還入壁，不敢復出。

translations.literal: Lou Fan wished shoot him, Xiang Wang glared eyes berated him, Lou Fan eyes not dared look, hand not dared release, then fled back entered fortifications, not dared again out.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu was defeated at Guling.

sentences.zh: 漢王使人閒問之，乃項王也。

translations.literal: Han Wang sent people secretly ask him, was Xiang Wang.
translations.idiomatic: He fled to Gaixia.

sentences.zh: 漢王大驚。

translations.literal: Han King was greatly shocked.
translations.idiomatic: Liu Bang surrounded him.

sentences.zh: 於是項王乃即漢王相與臨廣武閒而語。

translations.literal: Therefore Xiang Wang then approached Han Wang mutually faced Guangwu between and spoke.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu broke out at night.

sentences.zh: 漢王數之，項王怒，欲一戰。

translations.literal: Han Wang berated him, Xiang Wang angered, wished one battle.
translations.idiomatic: He fled to Wujiang.

sentences.zh: 漢王不聽，項王伏弩射中漢王。

translations.literal: Han Wang not listened, Xiang Wang hid crossbow shot hit Han Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu counted his followers.

sentences.zh: 漢王傷，走入成皋。

translations.literal: Han Wang wounded, fled entered Chenggao.
translations.idiomatic: Only twenty-eight horsemen remained.

translations.literal: Chu and Han had long confronted each other with no decision. Young men suffered from military service. The old and weak were exhausted from transporting grain. King Xiang said to Han King: 'The world has been in turmoil for several years, only because of us two. I wish to challenge Han King to decide the victor. Do not vainly make the world's people and their fathers and sons suffer.' Han King smiled and declined, saying: 'I would rather fight with wits, I cannot fight with strength.' King Xiang ordered brave warriors to go out and challenge. Han had a skilled horse archer named Lou Fan. Chu challenged three rounds. Lou Fan each time shot and killed them. King Xiang was greatly angered. He then personally donned armor, held a halberd, and challenged. Lou Fan wished to shoot him. King Xiang glared with his eyes and berated him. Lou Fan's eyes did not dare look, his hand did not dare release. He then fled back and entered the fortifications, not daring to come out again. Han King sent people to secretly ask him. It was King Xiang. Han King was greatly shocked. Therefore King Xiang then approached Han King and they mutually faced each other between Guangwu and spoke. Han King berated him. King Xiang was angered and wished for one battle. Han King did not listen. King Xiang hid and shot Han King with a crossbow. Han King was wounded and fled into Chenggao.

sentences.zh: 項王聞淮陰侯已舉河北，破齊、趙，且欲擊楚，乃使龍且往擊之。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang heard Huaiyin Hou already raised Hebei, broke Qi, Zhao, moreover wished strike Chu, then sent Long Ju go strike him.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said to his followers: "I started with eight thousand young men from Chu.

sentences.zh: 淮陰侯與戰，騎將灌嬰擊之，大破楚軍，殺龍且。

translations.literal: Huaiyin Hou with him fought, cavalry general Guan Ying struck him, greatly defeated Chu army, killed Long Ju.
translations.idiomatic: Today only these remain.

sentences.zh: 韓信因自立為齊王。

translations.literal: Han Xin took advantage self established as Qi Wang.
translations.idiomatic: If heaven wants to destroy me, what can I do?

sentences.zh: 項王聞龍且軍破，則恐，使盱臺人武涉往說淮陰侯。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang heard Long Ju army defeated, then feared, sent Xutai person Wu She go persuade Huaiyin Hou.
translations.idiomatic: But I will fight to the death."

sentences.zh: 淮陰侯弗聽。

translations.literal: Marquis Huaiyin did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: He divided his followers into four groups.

sentences.zh: 是時，彭越復反，下梁地，絕楚糧。

translations.literal: At this time, Peng Yue again rebelled, took Liang lands, cut off Chu grain.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked the Han army four times.

sentences.zh: 項王乃謂海春侯大司馬曹咎等曰：「謹守成皋，則漢欲挑戰，慎勿與戰，毋令得東而已。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang then said to Haichun Hou grand marshal Cao Jiu etc.: 'Carefully defend Chenggao, if Han wishes challenge, carefully do not with battle, do not let get east only.
translations.idiomatic: He beheaded a Han general and killed dozens of soldiers.

sentences.zh: 我十五日必誅彭越，定梁地，復從將軍。」

translations.literal: I fifteen days must execute Peng Yue, pacify Liang lands, again follow generals.'
translations.idiomatic: He looked back at Liu Bang.

sentences.zh: 乃東，行擊陳留、外黃。

translations.literal: Then east, en route struck Chenliu, Waihuang.
translations.idiomatic: He said: "This is my last battle."

translations.literal: King Xiang heard that Marquis Huaiyin had already raised Hebei, broken Qi and Zhao, and moreover wished to strike Chu. He then sent Long Ju to go strike him. Marquis Huaiyin fought with him. Cavalry general Guan Ying struck him. They greatly defeated the Chu army and killed Long Ju. Han Xin took advantage to self-establish as Qi King. King Xiang heard that Long Ju's army was defeated and then feared. He sent the Xutai man Wu She to go persuade Marquis Huaiyin. Marquis Huaiyin did not listen. At this time, Peng Yue again rebelled, took Liang territory, and cut off Chu's grain. King Xiang then said to Lord Haichun, Grand Marshal Cao Jiu, and others: 'Carefully defend Chenggao. If Han wishes to challenge, carefully do not battle with them. Only do not let them get east.' I will certainly execute Peng Yue in fifteen days, pacify Liang territory, and again follow the generals.' He then went east and en route struck Chenliu and Waihuang.

sentences.zh: 外黃不下。

translations.literal: Waihuang not submitted.
translations.idiomatic: He then committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 數日，已降，項王怒，悉令男子年十五已上詣城東，欲阬之。

translations.literal: Several days, already surrendered, Xiang Wang angered, all ordered males age fifteen and above go city east, wished bury them.
translations.idiomatic: His followers all died with him.

sentences.zh: 外黃令舍人兒年十三，往說項王曰：「彭越彊劫外黃，外黃恐，故且降，待大王。

translations.literal: Waihuang magistrate retainer child age thirteen, went persuaded Xiang Wang said: 'Peng Yue forcibly coerced Waihuang, Waihuang feared, therefore temporarily surrendered, waited great king.
translations.idiomatic: The world mourned Xiang Yu.

sentences.zh: 大王至，又皆阬之，百姓豈有歸心？

translations.literal: Great king arrived, moreover all bury them, common people how have allegiance heart?
translations.idiomatic: They said: "Chu still has Xiang Yu, but Han has Liu Bang."

sentences.zh: 從此以東，梁地十餘城皆恐，莫肯下矣。」

translations.literal: From this east, Liang lands ten more cities all fear, none willing submit.'
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: "Xiang Yu was brave but lacked strategy.

sentences.zh: 項王然其言，乃赦外黃當阬者。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang approved his words, then pardoned Waihuang should bury alive ones.
translations.idiomatic: He was generous but lacked governance.

sentences.zh: 東至睢陽，聞之皆爭下項王。

translations.literal: East arrived Suiyang, heard it all competed submitted Xiang Wang.
translations.idiomatic: He loved the people but lacked institutions."

translations.literal: Waihuang did not submit. After several days, they already surrendered. King Xiang was angered. He ordered all males fifteen years and above to go east of the city, wishing to bury them alive. Waihuang magistrate's retainer, a boy of thirteen, went and persuaded King Xiang, saying: 'Peng Yue forcibly coerced Waihuang. Waihuang feared, therefore temporarily surrendered, waiting for the great king. The great king arrives, and moreover buries them all alive. How will the common people have hearts of allegiance? East from this, all ten more cities in Liang territory will fear. None will be willing to submit.' King Xiang approved his words and then pardoned those in Waihuang who should have been buried alive. Going east to Suiyang, when they heard it, all competed to submit to King Xiang.

sentences.zh: 漢果數挑楚軍戰，楚軍不出。

translations.literal: Han indeed several times provoked Chu army battle, Chu army not came out.
translations.idiomatic: The Han army repeatedly provoked the Chu army to battle, but the Chu army would not come out.

sentences.zh: 使人辱之，五六日，大司馬怒，渡兵汜水。

translations.literal: Sent people insulted them, five six days, grand marshal angered, crossed troops Si water.
translations.idiomatic: They sent people to insult them. After five or six days, the Grand Marshal became angry and crossed his troops over the Si River.

sentences.zh: 士卒半渡，漢擊之，大破楚軍，盡得楚國貨賂。

translations.literal: Soldiers half crossed, Han struck them, greatly defeated Chu army, completely got Chu state goods bribes.
translations.idiomatic: When the soldiers were halfway across, the Han army attacked them, greatly defeating the Chu army and capturing all of Chu's goods and valuables.

sentences.zh: 大司馬咎、長史翳、塞王欣皆自剄汜水上。

translations.literal: Grand marshal Jiu, chief clerk Yi, Sai Wang Xin all self cut throats Si water on.
translations.idiomatic: Grand Marshal Jiu, Chief Clerk Yi, and King Xin of Sai all cut their own throats on the Si River.

sentences.zh: 大司馬咎者，故蘄獄掾，長史欣亦故櫟陽獄吏，兩人嘗有德於項梁，是以項王信任之。

translations.literal: Grand marshal Jiu, formerly Qi prison clerk, chief clerk Xin also formerly Queyang prison official, two people once had virtue to Xiang Liang, therefore Xiang Wang trusted them.
translations.idiomatic: Grand Marshal Jiu was formerly a clerk in the Qi prison. Chief Clerk Xin was also formerly an official in the Queyang prison. These two men had once shown virtue to Xiang Liang, which is why Xiang Yu trusted them.

sentences.zh: 當是時，項王在睢陽，聞海春侯軍敗，則引兵還。

translations.literal: At this time, Xiang Wang at Suiyang, heard Haichun Hou army defeated, then led troops returned.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Xiang Yu was at Suiyang. When he heard that the army of Marquis Haichun was defeated, he led his troops back.

sentences.zh: 漢軍方圍鐘離眛於滎陽東，項王至，漢軍畏楚，盡走險阻。

translations.literal: Han army just surrounding Zhongli Mo at Xingyang east, Xiang Wang arrived, Han army feared Chu, all fled dangerous places.
translations.idiomatic: The Han army was surrounding Zhongli Mo east of Xingyang. When Xiang Yu arrived, the Han army feared Chu and all fled to dangerous terrain.

translations.literal: Han indeed several times provoked the Chu army to battle. The Chu army did not come out. They sent people to insult them. After five or six days, the grand marshal was angered and crossed his troops over the Si River. The soldiers were half crossed when Han struck them. They greatly defeated the Chu army and completely got Chu's state goods and valuables. Grand Marshal Cao Jiu, Chief Clerk Dong Yi, and King Sai Sima Xin all cut their own throats on the Si River. Grand Marshal Cao Jiu had formerly been a Qi prison clerk. Chief Clerk Sima Xin had also formerly been a Queyang prison official. The two had once shown virtue to Xiang Liang, which is why King Xiang trusted them. At this time, King Xiang was at Suiyang. He heard that Lord Haichun's army was defeated and then led his troops back. The Han army was just surrounding Zhongli Mo east of Xingyang. King Xiang arrived. The Han army feared Chu and all fled to dangerous places.

sentences.zh: 是時，漢兵盛食多，項王兵罷食絕。

translations.literal: At this time, Han troops flourishing food plentiful, Xiang Wang troops exhausted food cut off.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the Han troops were flourishing with plentiful supplies, while Xiang Yu's troops were exhausted and cut off from food.

sentences.zh: 漢遣陸賈說項王，請太公，項王弗聽。

translations.literal: Han sent Lu Jia persuaded Xiang Wang, requested Tai Gong, Xiang Wang not listened.
translations.idiomatic: The Han sent Lu Jia to persuade Xiang Yu, requesting the return of his father, but Xiang Yu would not listen.

sentences.zh: 漢王復使侯公往說項王，項王乃與漢約，中分天下，割鴻溝以西者為漢，鴻溝而東者為楚。

translations.literal: Han Wang again sent Hou Gong go persuaded Xiang Wang, Xiang Wang then with Han agreed, middle divided world, divided Honggou west as Han, Honggou east as Chu.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king sent Marquis Hou again to persuade Xiang Yu. Xiang Yu then agreed with Han to divide the world in half, with the Honggou west going to Han and the Honggou east going to Chu.

sentences.zh: 項王許之，即歸漢王父母妻子。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang permitted it, immediately returned Han Wang parents wives children.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang permitted it, immediately returned Han Wang parents wives children. (translated).

sentences.zh: 軍皆呼萬歲。

translations.literal: The army all called 'ten thousand years.'
translations.idiomatic: The army all called 'ten thousand years.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢王乃封侯公為平國君。

translations.literal: Han Wang then enfeoffed Hou Gong as Pingguo Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang then enfeoffed Hou Gong as Pingguo Jun. (translated).

sentences.zh: 匿弗肯復見。

translations.literal: Hid not willing again see.
translations.idiomatic: Hid not willing again see. (translated).

sentences.zh: 曰：「此天下辯士，所居傾國，故號為平國君。」

translations.literal: Said: 'This world eloquent scholar, where he resides overthrows state, therefore titled Pingguo Jun.'
translations.idiomatic: Said: 'This world eloquent scholar, where he resides overthrows state, therefore titled Pingguo Jun.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王已約，乃引兵解而東歸。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang already agreed, then led troops withdrew and east returned.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang already agreed, then led troops withdrew and east returned. (translated).

translations.literal: At this time, Han's troops were flourishing and had plentiful food. King Xiang's troops were exhausted and their food was cut off. Han sent Lu Jia to persuade King Xiang and request Tai Gong. King Xiang did not listen. Han King again sent Marquis Hou Gong to go persuade King Xiang. King Xiang then agreed with Han to divide the world in the middle, with Honggou west going to Han and Honggou east going to Chu. King Xiang permitted it and immediately returned Han King's parents, wives, and children. The army all called 'ten thousand years.' Han King then enfeoffed Marquis Hou Gong as Lord Pingguo. He hid and was not willing to be seen again. He said: 'This is a world-class eloquent scholar. Wherever he resides, he overthrows the state. Therefore he is titled Lord Pingguo.' King Xiang had already agreed. He then led his troops to withdraw and return east.

sentences.zh: 漢欲西歸，張良、陳平說曰：「漢有天下太半，而諸侯皆附之。

translations.literal: Han wished west return, Zhang Liang, Chen Ping advised said: 'Han has world too half, and feudal lords all attach to it.
translations.idiomatic: Han wished west return, Zhang Liang, Chen Ping advised said: 'Han has world too half, and feudal lords all attach to it. (translated).

sentences.zh: 楚兵罷食盡，此天亡楚之時也，不如因其機而遂取之。

translations.literal: Chu troops exhausted food exhausted, this heaven destroy Chu time, better take advantage opportunity and then take it.
translations.idiomatic: Chu troops exhausted food exhausted, this heaven destroy Chu time, better take advantage opportunity and then take it. (translated).

sentences.zh: 今釋弗擊，此所謂『養虎自遺患』也。」

translations.literal: Now release not strike, this called 'raise tiger self leave calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: Now release not strike, this called 'raise tiger self leave calamity.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢王聽之。

translations.literal: Han King listened to it.
translations.idiomatic: Han King listened to it. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢五年，漢王乃追項王至陽夏南，止軍，與淮陰侯韓信、建成侯彭越期會而擊楚軍。

translations.literal: Han fifth year, Han Wang then pursued Xiang Wang to Yangxia south, stopped army, with Huaiyin Hou Han Xin, Jiancheng Hou Peng Yue agreed meeting and struck Chu army.
translations.idiomatic: Han fifth year, Han Wang then pursued Xiang Wang to Yangxia south, stopped army, with Huaiyin Hou Han Xin, Jiancheng Hou Peng Yue agreed meeting and struck Chu army. (translated).

sentences.zh: 至固陵，而信、越之兵不會。

translations.literal: Arrived Guling, and Xin, Yue troops not assembled.
translations.idiomatic: Arrived Guling, and Xin, Yue troops not assembled. (translated).

sentences.zh: 楚擊漢軍，大破之。

translations.literal: Chu struck Han army, greatly defeated it.
translations.idiomatic: Chu struck Han army, greatly defeated it. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢王復入壁，深塹而自守。

translations.literal: Han Wang again entered fortifications, deep moat and self defended.
translations.idiomatic: Han Wang again entered fortifications, deep moat and self defended. (translated).

sentences.zh: 謂張子房曰：「諸侯不從約，為之柰何？」

translations.literal: Said to Zhang Zifang: 'Feudal lords not follow agreement, do what?'
translations.idiomatic: Said to Zhang Zifang: 'Feudal lords not follow agreement, do what?' (translated).

sentences.zh: 對曰：「楚兵且破，信、越未有分地，其不至固宜。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Chu troops about broken, Xin, Yue not yet have divided lands, their not coming certainly appropriate.
translations.idiomatic: Replied said: 'Chu troops about broken, Xin, Yue not yet have divided lands, their not coming certainly appropriate. (translated).

sentences.zh: 君王能與共分天下，今可立致也。

translations.literal: Lord king able with them share divide world, now can immediately achieve.
translations.idiomatic: Lord king able with them share divide world, now can immediately achieve. (translated).

sentences.zh: 即不能，事未可知也。

translations.literal: If not able, matters not yet knowable.
translations.idiomatic: If not able, matters not yet knowable. (translated).

sentences.zh: 君王能自陳以東傅海，盡與韓信；

translations.literal: Lord king able self Chen east reaching sea, completely give to Han Xin;
translations.idiomatic: Lord king able self Chen east reaching sea, completely give to Han Xin; (translated).

sentences.zh: 睢陽以北至穀城，以與彭越：使各自為戰，則楚易敗也。」

translations.literal: Suiyang north to Gucheng, to give Peng Yue: make each self fight, then Chu easy defeat.'
translations.idiomatic: Suiyang north to Gucheng, to give Peng Yue: make each self fight, then Chu easy defeat.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢王曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Han King said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: Han King said: 'Good.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 於是乃發使者告韓信、彭越曰：「并力擊楚。

translations.literal: Therefore then sent envoys told Han Xin, Peng Yue said: 'Combine strength strike Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore then sent envoys told Han Xin, Peng Yue said: 'Combine strength strike Chu. (translated).

sentences.zh: 楚破，自陳以東傅海與齊王，睢陽以北至穀城與彭相國。」

translations.literal: Chu broken, self Chen east reaching sea give Qi Wang, Suiyang north to Gucheng give Peng chancellor.'
translations.idiomatic: Chu broken, self Chen east reaching sea give Qi Wang, Suiyang north to Gucheng give Peng chancellor.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 使者至，韓信、彭越皆報曰：「請今進兵。」

translations.literal: Envoys arrived, Han Xin, Peng Yue all replied said: 'Request now advance troops.'
translations.idiomatic: Envoys arrived, Han Xin, Peng Yue all replied said: 'Request now advance troops.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 韓信乃從齊往，劉賈軍從壽春并行，屠城父，至垓下。

translations.literal: Han Xin then from Qi went, Liu Jia army from Shouchun together went, slaughtered Chengfu, arrived Gaixia.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin then from Qi went, Liu Jia army from Shouchun together went, slaughtered Chengfu, arrived Gaixia. (translated).

sentences.zh: 大司馬周殷叛楚，以舒屠六，舉九江兵，隨劉賈、彭越皆會垓下，詣項王。

translations.literal: Grand marshal Zhou Yin rebelled Chu, with Shu slaughtered Liu, raised Jiujiang troops, followed Liu Jia, Peng Yue all assembled Gaixia, went to Xiang Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Grand marshal Zhou Yin rebelled Chu, with Shu slaughtered Liu, raised Jiujiang troops, followed Liu Jia, Peng Yue all assembled Gaixia, went to Xiang Wang. (translated).

translations.literal: Han wished to return west. Zhang Liang and Chen Ping advised, saying: 'Han has more than half the world, and all the feudal lords attach to it. Chu's troops are exhausted and food is exhausted. This is heaven's time to destroy Chu. It is better to take advantage of this opportunity and then take it. Now to release and not strike—this is what is called 'raising a tiger that leaves calamity for oneself.' Han King listened to it. In Han's fifth year, Han King then pursued King Xiang to south of Yangxia. He stopped his army and agreed to meet with Marquis Huaiyin Han Xin and Marquis Jiancheng Peng Yue to strike the Chu army. They arrived at Guling, but Xin and Yue's troops did not assemble. Chu struck the Han army and greatly defeated it. Han King again entered the fortifications, dug deep moats, and defended himself. He said to Zhang Zifang: 'The feudal lords do not follow the agreement. What should I do?' He replied: 'Chu's troops are about to be broken. Xin and Yue do not yet have divided lands. Their not coming is certainly appropriate. If the lord king is able to share and divide the world with them, it can be achieved immediately now. If not able, matters are not yet knowable. If the lord king is able to give from Chen east reaching the sea, completely to Han Xin; From Suiyang north to Gucheng, to give to Peng Yue: make each fight for themselves, then Chu will be easy to defeat.' Han King said: 'Good.' Therefore he then sent envoys to tell Han Xin and Peng Yue: 'Combine your strength to strike Chu. When Chu is broken, from Chen east reaching the sea to give to the Qi King, from Suiyang north to Gucheng to give to Chancellor Peng.' The envoys arrived. Han Xin and Peng Yue all replied: 'We request to advance troops now.' Han Xin then went from Qi. Liu Jia's army went together from Shouchun, slaughtered Chengfu, and arrived at Gaixia. Grand Marshal Zhou Yin rebelled against Chu. With Shu he slaughtered Liu, raised the Jiujiang troops, and followed Liu Jia and Peng Yue. They all assembled at Gaixia and went to King Xiang.

sentences.zh: 項王軍壁垓下，兵少食盡，漢軍及諸侯兵圍之數重。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang army fortified Gaixia, troops few food exhausted, Han army and feudal lords troops surrounded it several layers.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang army fortified Gaixia, troops few food exhausted, Han army and feudal lords troops surrounded it several layers. (translated).

sentences.zh: 夜聞漢軍四面皆楚歌，項王乃大驚曰：「漢皆已得楚乎？

translations.literal: Night heard Han army four sides all Chu songs, Xiang Wang then greatly startled said: 'Han all already got Chu?
translations.idiomatic: Night heard Han army four sides all Chu songs, Xiang Wang then greatly startled said: 'Han all already got Chu? (translated).

sentences.zh: 是何楚人之多也！」

translations.literal: What Chu people many!'
translations.idiomatic: What Chu people many!' (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王則夜起，飲帳中。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang then night rose, drank in tent.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang then night rose, drank in tent. (translated).

sentences.zh: 有美人名虞，常幸從；

translations.literal: Had beauty named Yu, constantly favored followed;
translations.idiomatic: Had beauty named Yu, constantly favored followed; (translated).

sentences.zh: 駿馬名騅，常騎之。

translations.literal: Fine horse named Zhui, constantly rode it.
translations.idiomatic: Fine horse named Zhui, constantly rode it. (translated).

sentences.zh: 於是項王乃悲歌慨，自為詩曰：「力拔山兮氣蓋世，時不利兮騅不逝。

translations.literal: Therefore Xiang Wang then sorrowful song heroic, self made poem said: 'Strength uproot mountain vigor cover world, time unfavorable Zhui not go.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Xiang Wang then sorrowful song heroic, self made poem said: 'Strength uproot mountain vigor cover world, time unfavorable Zhui not go. (translated).

sentences.zh: 騅不逝兮可柰何，虞兮虞兮柰若何！」

translations.literal: Zhui not go what can do, Yu Yu what do!'
translations.idiomatic: Zhui not go what can do, Yu Yu what do!' (translated).

sentences.zh: 歌數闋，美人和之。

translations.literal: Sang several stanzas, beauty harmonized it.
translations.idiomatic: Sang several stanzas, beauty harmonized it. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王泣數行下，左右皆泣，莫能仰視。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang wept several streams down, left right all wept, none could look up.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang wept several streams down, left right all wept, none could look up. (translated).

translations.literal: King Xiang's army was fortified at Gaixia. His troops were few and food exhausted. The Han army and feudal lords' troops surrounded it in several layers. At night he heard that on all four sides the Han army was singing Chu songs. King Xiang then was greatly startled and said: 'Has Han already gotten all of Chu? Why are there so many Chu people!' King Xiang then rose at night and drank in his tent. He had a beauty named Yu, whom he constantly favored and who followed him; A fine horse named Zhui, which he constantly rode. Therefore King Xiang then sang a sorrowful and heroic song. He made a poem for himself: 'Strength uproots mountains, vigor covers the world. Time is unfavorable, Zhui will not go. Zhui will not go—what can be done? Yu, Yu—what should I do with you!' He sang several stanzas. The beauty harmonized with him. King Xiang wept several streams of tears. All those on his left and right wept. None could look up.

sentences.zh: 於是項王乃上馬騎，麾下壯士騎從者八百餘人，直夜潰圍南出，馳走。

translations.literal: Therefore Xiang Wang then mounted horse, commanded brave warriors riding followers eight hundred more people, straight night broke encirclement south out, galloped fled.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Xiang Wang then mounted horse, commanded brave warriors riding followers eight hundred more people, straight night broke encirclement south out, galloped fled. (translated).

sentences.zh: 平明，漢軍乃覺之，令騎將灌嬰以五千騎追之。

translations.literal: Dawn, Han army then became aware, ordered cavalry general Guan Ying with five thousand riders pursue him.
translations.idiomatic: Dawn, Han army then became aware, ordered cavalry general Guan Ying with five thousand riders pursue him. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王渡淮，騎能屬者百餘人耳。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang crossed Huai, riders able follow one hundred more people only.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang crossed Huai, riders able follow one hundred more people only. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王至陰陵，迷失道，問一田父，田父紿曰「左」。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang arrived Yinling, lost way, asked one farmer, farmer deceived said 'left'.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang arrived Yinling, lost way, asked one farmer, farmer deceived said 'left'. (translated).

sentences.zh: 左，乃陷大澤中。

translations.literal: Left, then fell into great marsh.
translations.idiomatic: Left, then fell into great marsh. (translated).

sentences.zh: 以故漢追及之。

translations.literal: Therefore Han pursued caught him.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Han pursued caught him. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王乃復引兵而東，至東城，乃有二十八騎。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang then again led troops east, arrived Dongcheng, then had twenty eight riders.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang then again led troops east, arrived Dongcheng, then had twenty eight riders. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢騎追者數千人。

translations.literal: Han riders pursuing several thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: Han riders pursuing several thousand people. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王自度不得脫。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang self measured could not escape.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Wang self measured could not escape. (translated).

sentences.zh: 謂其騎曰：「吾起兵至今八歲矣，身七十餘戰，所當者破，所擊者服，未嘗敗北，遂霸有天下。

translations.literal: Said to his riders: 'I raised troops until now eight years, personally seventy more battles, what faced broken, what struck submitted, never defeated fled, then hegemon possessed world.
translations.idiomatic: Said to his riders: 'I raised troops until now eight years, personally seventy more battles, what faced broken, what struck submitted, never defeated fled, then hegemon possessed world. (translated).

sentences.zh: 然今卒困於此，此天之亡我，非戰之罪也。

translations.literal: Yet now finally trapped here, this heaven destroys me, not battle crime.
translations.idiomatic: Yet now finally trapped here, this heaven destroys me, not battle crime. (translated).

sentences.zh: 今日固決死，願為諸君快戰，必三勝之，為諸君潰圍，斬將，刈旗，令諸君知天亡我，非戰之罪也。」

translations.literal: Today certainly decide death, wish for various lords satisfying battle, must three victories, for various lords break encirclement, behead generals, cut banners, make various lords know heaven destroys me, not battle crime.'
translations.idiomatic: Today certainly decide death, wish for various lords satisfying battle, must three victories, for various lords break encirclement, behead generals, cut banners, make various lords know heaven destroys me, not battle crime.' (translated).

sentences.zh: 乃分其騎以為四隊，四向。

translations.literal: Then divided his riders into four teams, four directions.
translations.idiomatic: Then divided his riders into four teams, four directions. (translated).

sentences.zh: 漢軍圍之數重。

translations.literal: Han army surrounded it several layers.
translations.idiomatic: Han army surrounded it several layers. (translated).

sentences.zh: 項王謂其騎曰：「吾為公取彼一將。」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang said to his riders: 'I for you take that one general.'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said to his riders: "I will capture a general for you."

sentences.zh: 令四面騎馳下，期山東為三處。

translations.literal: Ordered four sides riders gallop down, agreed east mountain as three places.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered riders to gallop down from all four sides, dividing to meet at three places east of the mountain.

sentences.zh: 於是項王大呼馳下，漢軍皆披靡，遂斬漢一將。

translations.literal: Therefore Xiang Wang great shout galloped down, Han army all scattered, then beheaded Han one general.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu galloped out alone.

sentences.zh: 是時，赤泉侯為騎將，追項王，項王瞋目而叱之，赤泉侯人馬俱驚，辟易數里與其騎會為三處。

translations.literal: At this time, Chiquan Hou was cavalry general, pursued Xiang Wang, Xiang Wang glared eyes berated him, Chiquan Hou person horse both startled, retreated several li with his riders assembled as three places.
translations.idiomatic: He captured a Han general alive.

sentences.zh: 漢軍不知項王所在，乃分軍為三，復圍之。

translations.literal: Han army not know Xiang Wang location, then divided army into three, again surrounded them.
translations.idiomatic: He returned and showed him to the riders.

sentences.zh: 項王乃馳，復斬漢一都尉，殺數十百人，復聚其騎，亡其兩騎耳。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang then galloped, again beheaded Han one commandery captain, killed several ten hundred people, again gathered his riders, lost his two riders only.
translations.idiomatic: The riders were greatly encouraged.

sentences.zh: 乃謂其騎曰：「何如？」

translations.literal: He then said to his riders: 'How is it?'
translations.idiomatic: They said: "Our king is still mighty!"

sentences.zh: 騎皆伏曰：「如大王言。」

translations.literal: The riders all submitted and said: 'As the great king said.'
translations.idiomatic: They fought fiercely.

translations.literal: Therefore King Xiang then mounted his horse. His commanded brave warriors, with over eight hundred riders following, straight through the night broke the encirclement and went south out, galloping in flight. At dawn, the Han army then became aware and ordered cavalry general Guan Ying to pursue him with five thousand riders. King Xiang crossed the Huai. The riders able to follow were only over one hundred people. King Xiang arrived at Yinling. He lost his way and asked a farmer. The farmer deceived him and said 'left'. He went left and then fell into a great marsh. Therefore Han pursued and caught him. King Xiang then again led his troops east. He arrived at Dongcheng and then had twenty-eight riders. The Han riders pursuing were several thousand people. King Xiang measured himself and knew he could not escape. He said to his riders: 'I have raised troops for eight years until now. I have personally fought over seventy battles. Those I faced were broken. Those I struck submitted. I have never been defeated and fled. I then became hegemon and possessed the world. Yet now I am finally trapped here. This is heaven destroying me, not the crime of battle. Today I certainly decide on death. I wish to fight a satisfying battle for you various lords. I must achieve three victories, break the encirclement for you various lords, behead generals, cut banners, and make you various lords know that heaven destroys me, not the crime of battle.' He then divided his riders into four teams facing four directions. The Han army surrounded it in several layers. King Xiang said to his riders: 'I will take one of their generals for you.' He ordered the riders on all four sides to gallop down and agreed to meet east of the mountain at three places. Therefore King Xiang gave a great shout and galloped down. The Han army all scattered. He then beheaded one Han general. At this time, Lord Chiquan was the cavalry general pursuing King Xiang. King Xiang glared with his eyes and berated him. Lord Chiquan, both person and horse, were startled. He retreated several li and assembled with his riders at three places. The Han army did not know King Xiang's location. They then divided their army into three and again surrounded them. King Xiang then galloped. He again beheaded one Han commandery captain, killed several dozen people, again gathered his riders. He had only lost two riders. He then said to his riders: 'How is it?' The riders all submitted and said: 'As the great king said.'

sentences.zh: 於是項王乃欲東渡烏江。

translations.literal: Therefore Xiang Wang then wished east cross Wujiang.
translations.idiomatic: They captured dozens of horses.

sentences.zh: 烏江亭長檥船待，謂項王曰：「江東雖小，地方千里，眾數十萬人，亦足王也。

translations.literal: Wujiang pavilion chief moored boat waited, said to Xiang Wang: 'Jiangdong though small, territory thousand li, multitude several ten ten thousand people, also sufficient king.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu returned to the camp.

sentences.zh: 願大王急渡。

translations.literal: Wish great king urgently cross.
translations.idiomatic: He divided the meat and wine.

sentences.zh: 今獨臣有船，漢軍至，無以渡。」

translations.literal: Now only minister has boat, Han army arrives, nothing to cross.'
translations.idiomatic: He said: "This is my last feast with you."

sentences.zh: 項王笑曰：「天之亡我，我何渡為！

translations.literal: Xiang Wang laughed said: 'Heaven destroys me, I what cross for!
translations.idiomatic: The riders all cried.

sentences.zh: 且籍與江東子弟八千人渡江而西，今無一人還，縱江東父兄憐而王我，我何面目見之？

translations.literal: Moreover Ji with Jiangdong sons eight thousand crossed river west, now none one returns, even if Jiangdong fathers elders pity king me, I what face see them?
translations.idiomatic: They knew they could not escape.

sentences.zh: 縱彼不言，籍獨不愧於心乎？」

translations.literal: Even if they not speak, Ji alone not ashamed in heart?'
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu said: "I have lived for thirty years.

sentences.zh: 乃謂亭長曰：「吾知公長者。

translations.literal: Then said to pavilion chief: 'I know you elder.
translations.idiomatic: I have never been defeated.

sentences.zh: 吾騎此馬五歲，所當無敵，嘗一日行千里，不忍殺之，以賜公。」

translations.literal: I rode this horse five years, what faced no enemy, once one day traveled thousand li, not bear kill it, to bestow you.'
translations.idiomatic: But today I am trapped here.

sentences.zh: 乃令騎皆下馬步行，持短兵接戰。

translations.literal: Then ordered riders all dismount walk, hold short weapons close battle.
translations.idiomatic: This is fate.

sentences.zh: 獨籍所殺漢軍數百人。

translations.literal: Alone Ji what killed Han army several hundred people.
translations.idiomatic: I will fight to the death."

sentences.zh: 項王身亦被十餘創。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang body also suffered ten more wounds.
translations.idiomatic: He sang a song:

sentences.zh: 顧見漢騎司馬呂馬童，曰：「若非吾故人乎？」

translations.literal: Looked back saw Han cavalry adjutant Lu Matong, said: 'Are you not my old friend?'
translations.idiomatic: "The force of the wind rises, the clouds fly up.

sentences.zh: 馬童面之，指王翳曰：「此項王也。」

translations.literal: Matong faced him, pointed to Wang Yi said: 'This is Xiang Wang.'
translations.idiomatic: When my might is exhausted, I cannot return home.

sentences.zh: 項王乃曰：「吾聞漢購我頭千金，邑萬戶，吾為若德。」

translations.literal: Xiang Wang then said: 'I heard Han offers my head thousand gold, fief ten thousand households, I for you virtue.'
translations.idiomatic: When my might is exhausted, I cannot return home."

sentences.zh: 乃自刎而死。

translations.literal: Then self cut throat and died.
translations.idiomatic: He sang three times.

sentences.zh: 王翳取其頭，餘騎相蹂踐爭項王，相殺者數十人。

translations.literal: Wang Yi took his head, remaining riders mutually trampled contended Xiang Wang, mutually killed several ten people.
translations.idiomatic: The riders all cried.

sentences.zh: 最其後，郎中騎楊喜，騎司馬呂馬童，郎中呂勝、楊武各得其一體。

translations.literal: Finally, court gentleman rider Yang Xi, cavalry adjutant Lu Matong, court gentleman Lu Sheng, Yang Wu each got one part.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu mounted his horse.

sentences.zh: 五人共會其體，皆是。

translations.literal: Five people together assembled his body, all correct.
translations.idiomatic: He led his close followers, about eighty riders.

sentences.zh: 故分其地為五：封呂馬童為中水侯，封王翳為杜衍侯，封楊喜為赤泉侯，封楊武為吳防侯，封呂勝為涅陽侯。

translations.literal: Therefore divided his lands into five: enfeoffed Lu Matong as Zhongshui Hou, enfeoffed Wang Yi as Duyan Hou, enfeoffed Yang Xi as Chiquan Hou, enfeoffed Yang Wu as Wufang Hou, enfeoffed Lu Sheng as Nieyang Hou.
translations.idiomatic: He broke through the encirclement.

translations.literal: Therefore King Xiang then wished to cross east over the Wujiang. The Wujiang pavilion chief moored his boat and waited. He said to King Xiang: 'Though Jiangdong is small, its territory is a thousand li. Its multitude is several hundred thousand people. It is also sufficient to be king.' I wish the great king to urgently cross. Now only your minister has a boat. When the Han army arrives, there will be nothing to cross with.' King Xiang laughed and said: 'Heaven destroys me. Why should I cross! Moreover, I, Ji, crossed the river west with eight thousand Jiangdong sons. Now not one returns. Even if the Jiangdong fathers and elders pity me and make me king, what face would I have to see them? Even if they do not speak, would I, Ji, alone not be ashamed in my heart?' He then said to the pavilion chief: 'I know you are an elder. I have ridden this horse for five years. Those it faced had no enemy. Once it traveled a thousand li in one day. I cannot bear to kill it. I bestow it to you.' He then ordered all the riders to dismount and walk, holding short weapons for close battle. Alone, what I, Ji, killed were several hundred Han soldiers. King Xiang's body also suffered more than ten wounds. He looked back and saw the Han cavalry adjutant Lu Matong. He said: 'Are you not my old friend?' Matong faced him and pointed to Wang Yi, saying: 'This is King Xiang.' King Xiang then said: 'I heard Han offers a thousand gold for my head and a fief of ten thousand households. I will show you virtue.' He then cut his own throat and died. Wang Yi took his head. The remaining riders mutually trampled and contended for King Xiang. Those who mutually killed were several dozen people. Finally, the court gentleman rider Yang Xi, cavalry adjutant Lu Matong, court gentleman Lu Sheng, and Yang Wu each got one part of his body. The five people together assembled his body. It was all correct. Therefore they divided his lands into five: enfeoffed Lu Matong as Lord Zhongshui, enfeoffed Wang Yi as Lord Duyan, enfeoffed Yang Xi as Lord Chiquan, enfeoffed Yang Wu as Lord Wufang, enfeoffed Lu Sheng as Lord Nieyang.

sentences.zh: 項王已死，楚地皆降漢，獨魯不下。

translations.literal: Xiang Wang already dead, Chu lands all surrendered Han, only Lu not submitted.
translations.idiomatic: He went south.

sentences.zh: 漢乃引天下兵欲屠之，為其守禮義，為主死節，乃持項王頭視魯，魯父兄乃降。

translations.literal: Han then led world troops wished slaughter them, because they guarded rites righteousness, for lord died loyalty, then held Xiang Wang head showed Lu, Lu fathers elders then surrendered.
translations.idiomatic: He reached Wujiang.

sentences.zh: 始，楚懷王初封項籍為魯公，及其死，魯最後下，故以魯公禮葬項王穀城。

translations.literal: Beginning, Chu Huai Wang initially enfeoffed Xiang Ji as Lu Gong, and his death, Lu last submitted, therefore with Lu Gong rites buried Xiang Wang Gucheng.
translations.idiomatic: The Wujiang commander blocked the bridge.

sentences.zh: 漢王為發哀，泣之而去。

translations.literal: Han Wang for him issued mourning, wept and left.
translations.idiomatic: He said: "The Chu king cannot cross."

translations.literal: King Xiang was already dead. All Chu lands surrendered to Han. Only Lu did not submit. Han then led the world's troops and wished to slaughter them. Because they guarded rites and righteousness, dying in loyalty for their lord, they then held King Xiang's head and showed it to Lu. Lu's fathers and elders then surrendered. In the beginning, King Huai of Chu initially enfeoffed Xiang Ji as Duke of Lu. When he died, Lu submitted last. Therefore they buried King Xiang at Gucheng with the rites of a Duke of Lu. Han King issued mourning for him, wept, and left.

sentences.zh: 諸項氏枝屬，漢王皆不誅。

translations.literal: Various Xiang clan branches relatives, Han Wang all not executed.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu laughed.

sentences.zh: 乃封項伯為射陽侯。

translations.literal: Then enfeoffed Xiang Bo as Sheyang Hou.
translations.idiomatic: He said: "Why block me?

sentences.zh: 桃侯、平皋侯、玄武侯皆項氏，賜姓劉。

translations.literal: Tao Hou, Pinggao Hou, Xuanwu Hou all Xiang clan, granted surname Liu.
translations.idiomatic: Heaven wants to destroy me.

translations.literal: All the various Xiang clan branches and relatives, Han King did not execute. He then enfeoffed Xiang Bo as Lord Sheyang. Lord Tao, Lord Pinggao, and Lord Xuanwu were all of the Xiang clan. They were granted the surname Liu.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：吾聞之周生曰「舜目蓋重瞳子」，又聞項羽亦重瞳子。

translations.literal: Grand Scribe said: I heard from Zhou Sheng said 'Shun eyes probably double pupil', again heard Xiang Yu also double pupil.
translations.idiomatic: I will cross."

sentences.zh: 羽豈其苗裔邪？

translations.literal: Yu perhaps his descendants?
translations.idiomatic: He crossed the river.

sentences.zh: 何興之暴也！

translations.literal: What rise so fierce!
translations.idiomatic: He went to Yinling.

sentences.zh: 夫秦失其政，陳涉首難，豪傑蜂起，相與并爭，不可勝數。

translations.literal: Now Qin lost its governance, Chen She first rebelled, heroes swarmed rise, mutually united contended, cannot count.
translations.idiomatic: He beheaded himself.

sentences.zh: 然羽非有尺寸，乘執起隴畝之中，三年，遂將五諸侯滅秦，分裂天下，而封王侯，政由羽出，號為「霸王」，位雖不終，近古以來未嘗有也。

translations.literal: Yet Yu not had inch, rode plow rose fields middle, three years, then led five feudal lords extinguished Qin, split world, and enfeoffed kings marquises, government from Yu out, titled 'Hegemon King', position though not ended, near ancient since never had.
translations.idiomatic: His followers all committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 及羽背關懷楚，放逐義帝而自立，怨王侯叛己，難矣。

translations.literal: When Yu turned against passes longed Chu, banished Righteous Emperor and self established, resented kings marquises rebelled him, difficult.
translations.idiomatic: The world mourned him.

sentences.zh: 自矜功伐，奮其私智而不師古，謂霸王之業，欲以力征經營天下，五年卒亡其國，身死東城，尚不覺寤而不自責，過矣。

translations.literal: Self boasted merit achievements, exerted his private wisdom and not followed ancient, considered hegemon king enterprise, wished with force conquest managed world, five years finally perished his state, body died Dongcheng, still not aware awoke and not self blamed, mistake.
translations.idiomatic: They said: "Alas, Xiang Yu!

sentences.zh: 乃引「天亡我，非用兵之罪也」，豈不謬哉！

translations.literal: Then cited 'Heaven destroys me, not using troops crime', how not mistaken!
translations.idiomatic: He was a hero among men."

translations.literal: The Grand Scribe said: I heard from Zhou Sheng that 'Shun's eyes were probably double-pupiled.' I also heard that Xiang Yu was double-pupiled. Was Yu perhaps his descendant? What a fierce rise! Qin lost its governance. Chen She first rebelled. Heroes swarmed and rose. They mutually united and contended. They cannot be counted. Yet Yu had not an inch of land. He rode the plow and rose from the middle of the fields. In three years, he then led the five feudal lords to extinguish Qin, split the world, and enfeoffed kings and marquises. Government came from Yu. He was titled 'Hegemon King.' Though his position did not last, since near ancient times there has never been such. When Yu turned against the passes and longed for Chu, banished the Righteous Emperor and self-established, resented that kings and marquises rebelled against him—it was difficult. He self-boasted of his merits and achievements. He exerted his private wisdom and did not follow the ancients. He considered the hegemon king's enterprise and wished to manage the world with force and conquest. In five years he finally perished his state. His body died at Dongcheng. He still did not become aware and awake, and did not blame himself. It was a mistake. He then cited 'Heaven destroys me, it is not the crime of using troops.' How is this not mistaken!
